The home side took the lead when Boyd found the right-hand corner of the net with a left-footed shot.

Leicester City claimed their fifth successive Premier League victory under Craig Shakespeare with a home win over Sunderland.
Second-half goals by Islam Slimani and Jamie Vardy ended Sunderland’s resistance.
The champions started strongly with Shinji Okazaki finding the side-netting early on, while Jermain Defoe and Didier Ndong fired over from range for the visitors.
Demarai Gray brought a magnificent save out of Jordan Pickford on the stroke of half-time, but two substitutes combined to break the deadlock on 69 minutes, Marc Albrighton’s searching cross glanced in by Slimani.
And moments after Victor Anichebe hit the post, Vardy scored his sixth goal in seven PL matches from another Albrighton centre.
Leicester rise to 10th place while Sunderland remain bottom, eight points from safety.

Watford won a home league match against West Bromwich Albion for the first time since 1994 to move into the top half of the Premier League.
The hosts capitalised on a promising start when Troy Deeneydeft header fell to fellow forward M’Baye Niang, who took a touch on the edge of the area before arrowing a spectacular strike into the top corner.

A last-gasp penalty from Zlatan Ibrahimovic rescued a point for Manchester United against Everton.
The visitors took the lead from a corner, Ashley Williams’ flick-on turned in by Phil Jagielka with his back to goal.

Swansea City and Middlesbrough shared the points in a hard-fought goalless draw at Liberty Stadium.
The home side, who were missing Fernando Llorente through injury, dominated the first half, with Tom Carroll’s long-range shot just wide.
The loss of Gaston Ramirez through injury reduced Boro’s creativity with Adama Traore’s pace their main threat.
In the second half Victor Valdes, who was the busier goalkeeper, denied Gylfi Sigurdsson’s long-range shot.
Swansea put Boro under late pressure as Sigurdsson’s deflected free-kick brushed a post while Rudy Gestede headed a great stoppage-time chance wide for Boro.

Shkodran Mustafi's header denied Manchester City a chance to move up to third in the Premier League as Arsenal earned a 2-2 draw at Emirates Stadium.
The Germany international glanced Mesut Ozil's corner past Willy Caballero to leave sixth-placed Arsenal within seven points of Man City in fourth.
The match got off to a blistering start, with Leroy Sane latching on to Kevin De Bruyne's through ball, rounding David Ospina and slotting in Man City's opener on five minutes, moments after Danny Welbeck fired narrowly wide.
Theo Walcott levelled following Mustafi's header into the penalty area on 40 minutes, before Sergio Aguero's drilled effort from a tight angle put City back in front before half-time.
Aguero missed with a free header soon after the break, and Arsenal capitalised with Mustafi's leveller.

Liverpool maintained their Merseyside derby dominance at Anfield with a 3-1 win over Everton.
Matthew Pennington equalised for Everton on 28 minutes after Liverpool failed to clear a corner but the parity lasted less than three minutes as Philippe Coutinho restored Liverpool’s lead with a trademark curling shot.
Man of the Match: Philippe Coutinho

Tottenham Hotspur cut the gap to leaders Chelsea to seven points with a 2-0 win at Burnley. 
Mauricio Pochettino moved Eric Dier into midfield after the break and the 23-year-old's first goal of the season made it 1-0 when Burnley failed to clear Christian Eriksen's corner. 
Substitute Son Heung-min sealed the win in the 77th minute as Spurs capitalised on Chelsea's home defeat to Crystal Palace.
Burnley drop to 15th, five points clear of the relegation zone.

Cesc Fabregas flicked in Eden Hazard's cross to give the Blues a fifth-minute lead, but Sam Allardyce's side rallied and struck twice in as many minutes. 
Wilfried Zaha's shot from just inside the box levelled before Christian Benteke dinked in his 10th goal of the season in the 11th minute.
Chelsea pushed in a bid to avoid only a second home defeat of the season but could not beat Wayne Hennessey, who saved superbly from Diego Costa, Marcos Alonso and Eden Hazard.
Chelsea report | Crystal Palace report

Hull City boosted their Premier League survival hopes by coming from behind to defeat West Ham United at the KCOM Stadium.
Andy Carroll struck his 50th Premier League goal, chesting down an Aaron Cresswell cross to open the scoring from close range.

Jonathan Walters had an early chance from wide on the left kept out by Kasper Schmeichel before Wilfred Ndidi put the hosts ahead.The 20 year old collected the ball from 30 yards out and fired in a spectacular drive into the top corner to give Leicester City a half time lead.
Just moments after the restart and Jamie Vardy doubled Leicester City’s lead.The Premier League champions move six points clear of the relegation zone, while Stoke City remain in the top half of the table.

West Bromwich Albion produced a first-class defensive display to deny Manchester United at Old Trafford.
Jesse Lingard and Anthony Martial missed chances before the break, while after half-time, Darren Fletcher scuffed a close-range effort for the visitors before Marouane Fellaini missed from six yards for United.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan forced a fine save from Ben Foster and Rashford's powerful 30-yard effort was also well saved.

Miguel Britos headed a second-half winner for Watford against Sunderland.
Sunderland started brightly and Adnan Januzaj’s shot was saved by Heurelho Gomes after just nine minutes.
But Jordan Pickford was the busier goalkeeper in the first half, saving from M’Baye Niang and Craig Cathcart, while Etienne Capoue shot wide.
The winner came from Tom Cleverley's corner on 59 minutes, as Cathcart headed it back across goal and Britos nodded in.
Isaac Success could have doubled the lead, but the score ended 1-0 with Watford up to 12th on 34 points.

Harry Arter missed a penalty and the chance to earn AFC Bournemouth their first win over Southampton at St Mary’s Stadium.
After AFC Bournemouth’s Andrew Surman’s effort was cleared off the line, Southampton rallied.
Dusan Tadic hit a post, Maya Yoshida headed over and Jay Rodriguez forced Artur Boruc into a save.
After the break AFC Bournemouth's Benik Afobe put a good chance wide, while James Ward-Prowse and Shane Long did similar at the other end.
Adam Smith hit a post, but the best chance fell to Arter, 11 minutes before the end after Ryan Fraser had been fouled in the box, but he skied his penalty.
The two sides are on 34 points, with Southampton a place better off in 10th.
Man of the Match: Dusan Tadic

Manchester United became the first side to claim 600 victories in the Premier League thanks to a hard-fought 3-1 win at Middlesbrough.
Boro, with Steve Agnew in caretaker charge following the departure of Aitor Karankak, started brightly but Marouane Fellaini put United ahead with a close-range header on the half-hour mark.
Jesse Lingard then doubled United's lead on 62 minutes with a superb strike into the top corner from outside the area.
The home side pulled a goal back through substitute Rudy Gestede with 13 minutes left but despite piling on the pressure, United sealed the three points when Antonio Valencia tapped in after a Victor Valdes slip.
United move above Arsenal into fifth place while Middlesbrough remain in the bottom three, five points from safety.

Tottenham Hotspur maintained their unbeaten home record in the Premier League with a 2-1 victory over Southampton that closes the gap on leaders Chelsea.
The home side took the lead on 14 minutes through Christian Eriksen's fine left-footed finish into the bottom corner.
Dele Alli then doubled Spurs' lead from the penalty spot on 33 minutes after he was fouled by Steven Davis.
Saints found a way back into the contest when James Ward-Prowse scored seven minutes into the second period but despite putting on the pressure, they could not claim an equaliser.
Second-placed Spurs are 10 points behind Chelsea, while Southampton remain 10th.

Sergio Aguero's goal kept Manchester City above Liverpool in the Premier League as they fought back to earn a pulsating 1-1 draw at the Etihad Stadium.
After a goalless first-half finished with a flurry of chances, Liverpool went ahead when James Milner coolly scored a penalty following Gael Clichy's foul on Roberto Firmino.
But Aguero converted Kevin De Bruyne's brilliant centre on 68 minutes.
Then De Bruyne rattled the post and Aguero blasted over for City late on, while Liverpool's Adam Lallana scuffed a fantastic opportunity when he was unmarked six yards out late on.
, one point and a place above Liverpool with a match in hand.

Craig Dawson scored two headers as West Bromwich Albion stunned Arsenal with a 3-1 home win.
Arsenal fell behind to Dawson heading in Nacer Chadli’s corner on 12 minutes.
Alexis Sanchez equalised three minutes later but Arsenal suffered a blow when goalkeeper Petr Cech went off injured.
Albion restored their lead on 55 minutes when Hal Robson-Kanu prodded in a minute after coming on and, after Danny Welbeck had struck the bar for Arsenal, Dawson struck again with a header from James McClean's corner.

Crystal Palace secured their third consecutive Premier League win with a 1-0 victory over Watford.
Troy Deeney’s own goal settled the contest, the Watford captain sending Yohan Cabaye’s free-kick past Heurelho Gomes on 68 minutes.
A close-fought first half might have brought a goal for Valon Behrami, who fired over for Watford on the stroke of half-time, shortly after Wilfried Zaha had done likewise at the other end.
Zaha almost gave Palace the lead on 65 minutes when he beat his marker, only to fire high again.
Watford are three points better off in 13th.

Two late goals made Romelu Lukaku the first Everton player to reach 20 Premier League goals as the Toffees beat Hull City 4-0.
Everton took the lead at Goodison Park on nine minutes as Dominic Calvert-Lewin converted Tom Davies’s cross for his first league goal.
Sam Clucas spurned a chance to equalise for Hull by firing over.
Everton above Manchester United into sixth on 50 points, while Hull stay in the relegation zone.

Chelsea extended their lead in the Premier League to 13 points as Gary Cahill’s late goal helped them to a 2-1 win at Stoke City.
Willian’s free-kick on 13 minutes eluded Lee Grant at the near post to give Chelsea the lead.
Stoke equalised through Jonathan Walters’ penalty after the Irishman was fouled by Cahill.
Marcos Alonso’s free-kick hit the bar and Grant denied Pedro as Chelsea sought to restore their lead.
Their efforts were rewarded when Cahill reacted quickest to a loose ball in the area after a corner 12 minutes before the end.

Sunderland remain bottom of the Premier League after being held to a goalless draw at home by Burnley.
Barnes could have put Burnley ahead in the first half when he poked Scott Arfield’s cross wide from close range.
Sunderland improved after the break and Adnan Januzaj, having seen an earlier volley saved by Tom Heaton, sent a low strike past the outside of the post.
Burnley almost snatched a late victory when Sam Vokes was denied by Jordan Pickford as the Clarets’ search for a first away

Leicester City continued their resurgence with an enthralling 3-2 victory at West Ham United.
The Foxes raced into a two-goal lead in seven minutes, Riyad Mahrez opening the scoring before Robert Huth headed in Marc Albrighton’s cross.
West Ham, who lost both Winston Reid and Pedro Obiang to injuries, pulled a goal back through Manuel Lanzini's sublime free-kick, but Jamie Vardy restored Leicester’s two-goal lead from a corner before the break.
Andre Ayew revived West Ham’s

Benik Afobe scored one and set up the other as AFC Bournemouth registered back-to-back victories, beating Swansea City 2-0.
Gylfi Sigurdsson almost levelled before half-timeSwansea stepped up the pressure as the second half went on but were caught in the 72nd minute when Afobe was played in by Joshua King and fired home to make it 2-0 .
The win lifts AFC Bournemouth to 11th on 33 points, nine clear of the relegation zone.

Georginio Wijnaldum and Emre Can were on target as Liverpool came from behind to beat Burnley 2-1 at Anfield.
Burnley got off to a fine start when Ashley Barnes prodded in Matt Lowton's fine pass with seven minutes gone.
Liverpool struggled to find their momentum but were level on the stroke of half-time thanks to Wijnaldum, who converted Divock Origi’s cross for the equaliser.
Burnley remain 12th on 31 points.

Joshua King scored a hat-trick as AFC Bournemouth atoned for two missed penalties with a 3-2 victory over West Ham United at Vitality Stadium.
Moments after King dragged a spot-kick wide when Charlie Daniels was fouled by Sofiane Feghouli, the West Ham winger teed up Michail Antonio to for the visitors’ opener.
King brilliantly controlled and finished to level on 31 minutes and gave the Cherries a 2-1 lead either side of Darren Randolph’s save from Benik Afobe’s penalty.
Substitute Andre Ayew converted West Ham’s second from Sam Byram’s cut-back with seven minutes remaining, but King sealed the Cherries’ first win of 2017 when he followed up Jack Wilshere’ssaved effort in the 90th minute.

Romelu Lukaku moved level with Harry Kane at the top of the Premier League goalscorers' chart with the last goal in Everton’s 3-0 win over West Bromwich Albion
Kevin Mirallas broke the deadlock in the 39th minute, pouncing after Baggies goalkeeper Ben Foster had saved Ross Barkley’s shot.

Substitute Oumar Niasse scored twice in nine minutes as Hull City beat relegation rivals Swansea City 2-1.
Wayne Routledge missed a great chance when he fired over from eight yards.
Swansea halved the deficit in stoppage time as Alfie Mawson headed home Gylfi Sigurdsson’s free-kick.

Manchester City missed the chance to move second in the Premier League table after being held to a goalless draw by Stoke City.
The visitors might have taken the lead in the first half but Willy Caballero saved from Mame Biram Diouf’s deflected shot andBruno Martins Indi squandered Phil Bardsley’s free-kick.
Man City picked up in the second half with Leroy Sane blazing over, David Silva firing wide and Nicolas Otamendi heading over.
Sergio Aguero, Kelechi Iheanacho and Sane all passed up late chances but Stoke held firm.

Chelsea restored their 10-point lead at the top of the Premier League table with a 2-1 victory at London rivals West Ham United.
The Blues struggled to get into their rhythm early on but they took the lead on 25 minutes when Eden Hazard calmly finished off a fine counterattack.
Diego Costa made it 2-0 in the second half when he forced home Cesc Fabregas's corner, and he had a chance to add anotherWith time running out, Manuel Lanzini pulled a goal back for the Hammersbut it was too little too late as Chelsea extended their unbeaten run to seven matches.

Two goals from Harry Kane helped second-placed Tottenham Hotspur claim a 3-2 victory over Everton that moves them to within seven points of Premier League leaders Chelsea.
Everton were given a lifeline when Romelu Lukaku pulled a goal back with 10 minutes left.
Dele Alli seemed to seal the win when he prodded home a clever Harry Winks free-kick in stoppage timebut, a minute later, Enner Valencia added an Everton second from a Ross Barkley set-piece.
Harry Kane

Sergio Aguero and Leroy Sane scored as Manchester City returned to third position in the Premier League with a 2-0 success against Sunderland.
After Jermain Defoe hit the post from distance for bottom club Sunderland, Aguero deftly flicked the ball over Jordan Pickford to open the scoring on 42 minutes.
Sane doubled City’s advantage when he hit the inside of Pickford’s post after David Silva’s

Leicester City fought back from a goal down against Hull City to win for the second match in a row.
In Craig Shakespeare's second match as caretaker manager, Leicester fell behind to Sam Clucas's first Premier League goal on 14 minutes, assisted by Kamil Grosicki.
Christian Fuchs levelled before half-time after good work with Jamie Vardy and Riyad Mahrez completed the turnaround on the hour with his first PL goal since November from the edge of the box.
Leicester report | Hull report

Marko Arnautovic scored a brace to secure Stoke City's eighth consecutive home Premier League win at the expense of Middlesbrough. 
The winger opened the scoring after 29 minutes, expertly controlling Glenn Whelan's lofted pass and smashing into the roof of the net.
Middlesbrough came close to scoring in the second half, but Ben Gibson's goal was ruled out for offside.
Middlesbrough drop into the bottom three after Crystal Palace's win at West Bromwich Albion.

Fernando Llorente scored in stoppage time as Swansea City came from behind to beat Burnley 3-2. 
Llorente's header opened the scoring after 12 minutes but Andre Gray levelled from the penalty spot after a handball. 
Gray's second of the match put Burnley on course for their first away win of the season, until Martin Olsson made it 2-2 after a Gylfi Sigurdsson backheel put him through.
Burnley drop to 12th.

Manolo Gabbiadini became the first Southampton player to score in his first three Premier League matches as the Saints triumphed 4-3 in a thriller at Watford.
hosts took the lead in the fourth minute thanks to Troy Deeney’s left-footed volley, but Dusan Tadic equalised before setting up Nathan Redmond as Southampton took a 2-1 lead into the break.
Stefano Okaka levelled for Watford with 11 minutes left, but Gabbiadini promptly put the visitors back in front and Redmond doubled his tally for the day.

Liverpool moved into the top three and above Arsenal, beating them 3-1 at Anfield.
The hosts took the lead on nine minutes when Roberto Firmino controlled Sadio Mane’s centre and beat Petr Cech.
Arsenal threatened a fightback when half-time substitute Alexis Sanchez's through-ball allowed Danny Welbeck to beat Simon Mignolet on 57 minutes,
But Liverpool made sure of the points in stoppage time when Georginio Wijnaldum scored on the break.
Man of the match Sadio Mane (Liverpool)

Manchester United missed the chance to move into the top four as they were held by 10-man AFC Bournemouth at Old Trafford.
Jose Mourinho’s team dominated from the start and led when Marcos Rojo deflected in Antonio Valencia’s shot on 23 minutes.
AFC Bournemouth were level after 40 minutes when Marc Pugh was brought down and Joshua King converted from the spot against his former team.
Zlatan Ibrahimovic had a chance to win it for United in the 71st minute but Artur Boruc saved his penalty.

Andros Townsend ran the length of the field to wrap up a valuable 2-0 victory for Crystal Palace over West Bromwich Albion that moved them out of the relegation zone.
Palace forward Christian Benteke’s shot was headed off the line in a goalless first half but Wilfried Zaha broke the deadlock after the break, chesting down Yohan Cabaye’sSix minutes from time, Townsend won the ball on the edge of his own box and raced upfield before scoring with a deflected strike.

With Craig Shakespeare in charge after Claudio Ranieri's exit last week, Leicester scored their first Premier League goal of 2017 when Vardy slotted in from Marc Albrighton's through-ball.
Drinkwater doubled the lead on 39 minutes, firing in from 25 yards, before Vardy added a third after the break, heading in Christian Fuchs' cross.
Liverpool got a goal back through Philippe Coutinho but could not stop Leicester climbing to 15th, two points above the drop zone.
Liverpool remain fifth, one point behind Arsenal and ahead ofMan of the match Jamie Vardy (Leicester City)

A Harry Kane hat-trick took him to the top of the Premier League scoring charts and lifted Tottenham Hotspur to second as they beat Stoke City 4-0 for the third match in a row.
He also crossed for Dele Alli to make it 4-0 in first-half stoppage time.
Stoke remain 10th in the Premier League.

Cesc Fabregas marked his 300th Premier League match with a goal and an assist as Chelsea defeated Swansea City 3-1 to extend their lead at the top of the table to 11 points.
Fabregas, the first Spanish player to reach the milestone in the Premier League, gathered Pedro’s pass and prodded home in the 19th minute.
But a Pedro strike squirmed under Lukasz Fabianski and Eden Hazard teed up Diego Costa as Chelsea struck twice inside the final 20 minutes to secure a dominant home win.

Patrick van Aanholt's first Crystal Palace goal lifted the Eagles out of the bottom three with a narrow victory over Middlesbrough.
Middlesbrough goalkeeper Victor Valdes denied both Christian Benteke and Jason Puncheon before being beaten by Van Aanholt, while James McArthur failed to sort out his feet after being played in by Wilfried Zaha.
Cristhian Stuani struck Boro's best opportunity straight at Wayne Hennessey, as the south Londoners held firm to move above Leicester City and Hull City into 17th place.
Crystal Palace report | Middlesbrough report

Idrissa Gueye and Romelu Lukaku stretched Everton's unbeaten run to nine matches with a 2-0 win against Sunderland. 
Gueye smashed in his first Premier League goal after 40 minutes, beating fit-again goalkeeper Jordan Pickford after being set up by Seamus Coleman. 
Tom Davies struck the post from the edge of the box before Sunderland came close to equalising, Jermain Defoe's effort crashing against the crossbar.
Everton report | Sunderland report

Burnley secured their second away point of the season as they came from behind to draw 1-1 with Hull City at the KCOM Stadium.
Marco Silva’s side dominated possession in a tight first half, but it was the visitors who mustered the only shots on target as George Boyd and Ben Mee tested Eldin Jakupovic.
Inside four minutes Keane made amends finishing with his right foot from Robbie Brady’s corner. 
Despite Ashley Barnes being sent off in the closing stages, the visitors held firm to claim a valuable point.

West Bromwich Albion climbed to 40 points with a 2-1 victory over AFC Bournemouth at The Hawthorns.
The Cherries took the lead inside five minutes when Joshua King converted from the penalty spot after Ryan Fraser was fouled by Allan Nyom.
The defeat leaves AFC Bournemouth on 26 points just five points above the relegation zone.

Andre Ayew claimed a second-half equaliser to give West Ham United a deserved draw at Vicarage Road.
Watford had taken the lead with Troy Deeney's third-minute penalty but the visitors had the better of the chances thereafter, goalkeeper Heurelho Gomes saving well to deny Jose Fonte.
The Hammers held on for a point after playing the final four minutes with 10 men after Antonio was sent off for the first time in his professional career, Isaac Success missing a chance to claim the winner right at the end.

Manchester City are second in the Premier League after a 2-0 win at AFC Bournemouth.
Shortly after his shot was deflected on to the woodwork, Raheem Sterling converted Leroy Sane’sbut Joshua King’s effort was ruled out for a foul.
Raheem Sterling

The visitors had the perfect start to the contest, with Pedro collecting a Victor Moses centre and slotting the ball past Tom Heaton in the seventh minute.
But Burnley drew level on 24 minutes as Brady's left-footed free-kick found the top corner, and they had chances to grab the lead but Thibaut Courtois saved well from both Matthew Lowton and Andre Gray.

Swansea City moved four points clear of the Premier League relegation zone in 15th place after beating Leicester City 2-0 at the Liberty Stadium.
January signing Martin Olsson, a left-back, fired the ball through the legs of Kasper Schmeichel after a wonderful pass from Gylfi Sigurdsson in first-half stoppage time.

Alexis Sanchez scored in both halves as Arsenal ended their two-match losing run with a 2-0 home win over Hull City.
Hull began brightly and Oumar Niasse forced a save from Petr Cech, but Sanchez scored from close range on 34 minutes after Kieran Gibbs’s shot had been blocked.
Adama Diomande headed a great chance for a Hull equaliser over late on.
Sanchez doubled his tally to move top of the scorers’ chart on 17 goals with a stoppage-time penalty after Sam Clucas had handled Lucas Perez’s goalbound header, earning a red card.
Arsenal move third, nine points behind leaders Chelsea, while Hull remain on 20 points.

Anthony Martial scored one goal and made another as Manchester United beat Watford to stretch their unbeaten league run to 16 matches – the longest since Sir Alex Ferguson retired.
Juan Mata broke the deadlock on 32 minutes when he turned in Martial’s cross from close range.
Mauro Zarate forced David De Gea to save his 25-yard free-kick after the breakbut it was brief respite for Watford.
Martial doubled the lead on the hour when he took a Zlatan Ibrahimovic pass, cut in from the left and slotted home to give United their 2,000th Premier League point.

The goalkeeper tipped over a close-range header from substitute Rudy Gestede to keep the scores level.
The Premier League's top scorer at the start of the weekend, Romelu Lukaku, was denied adding to his 16 goals for the season by Victor Valdes, who also stopped Ademola Lookman's shot after the break.
Lookman also missed a chance after being played in by Ross Barkley, as the match ended goalless, the 10th time this season Middlesbrough have failed to score.
The shared points keep Everton in seventh, while Boro remain 15th, two points off the bottom three.

Joe Allen's composed second-half goal allowed Stoke City to break the resistance of a resolute Crystal Palace.
Stoke began brightly as Marko Arnautovic forced a save from Wayne Hennessey inside 10 minutes.
Peter Crouch went close with a header before the break, while Palace full-back Patrick van Aanholt had a fierce shot saved.

Manolo Gabbiadini made it three goals in two matches since signing for Southampton in their 4-0 win over Sunderland at the Stadium of Light.
Jermain Defoe had threatened early on for Sunderland, before Gabbiadini deflected in Ryan Bertrand's cross on 30 minutes.
Dusan Tadic went close before a Jason Denayer own goal and a late Shane Long strike confirmed the three points that lifted Southampton to 11th, while Sunderland remain bottom.

Gareth McAuley scored deep into stoppage time to seal a point for West Bromwich Albion at West Ham United.
West Ham equalised in the second half when Manuel Lanzini’s shot was pushed on to the bar, only for Sofiane Feghouli to tap in the rebound.
Ben Foster denied West Ham a second, but could not keep out another Lanzini long shot with four minutes left.
But West Brom denied the home side victory when Chris Brunt's corner was headed goalwards by Jonny Evans, whose header came off McAuley before going in.

Sadio Mane scored twice as a blistering first-half display ended Liverpool’s five-match winless run with victory over Tottenham Hotspur.
The winger, who missed most of January on Africa Cup of Nations duty, opened the scoring after 16 minutes, finishing Georginio Wijnaldum’s sumptuous through-ball.
Liverpool had further chances to score in the first half, although Spurs' Son Heung-min also had a shot well saved by Simon Mignolet.
The contest was more even in the second half although Joel Matip headed straight at Lloris and Philippe Coutinho shot wide.

Gabriel Jesus scored a stoppage-time winner as Manchester City fought off a Swansea City comeback to claim a 2-1 victory at the Etihad Stadium.
The Brazilian tapped in after his header from David Silva was parried by Lukasz Fabianski into his path.
Jesus, starting ahead of late substitute Sergio Aguero, also scored Man City's opener from close range on 11 minutes.
But Man City were punished for not adding to their lead as Gylfi Sigurdsson's low strike from outside the penalty area beat Willy Caballero, before Jesus had the final say.

The two sides were evenly matched in the opening exchanges but United started to gain control and after Marcus Rashford's shot was well saved by Kasper Schmeichel at the near post, they took the lead with a fine breakaway goal from Henrikh Mkhitaryan on 42 minutes.
And United's victory was sealed four minutes after the break through Juan Mata, who finished after a smart passing move.
Leicester City report | Manchester United report

Eden Hazard scored a stunning goal as Chelsea hit Arsenal’sAfter an open start, Antonio Conte’s team took control from 13 minutes when Marcos Alonso followed up after Diego Costa’s header hit the bar.
Hazard doubled Chelsea’s lead on 53 minutes with a mazy run from his own half that left Arsenal’s defence in confusion.
Man of the Match Eden Hazard (Chelsea)

Sunderland drew level with Crystal Palace at the bottom of the Premier League with a convincing 4-0 victory at Selhurst Park.
Lamine Kone put Sunderland in front when he followed up after Wayne Hennessy could not collect his header.
Didier Ndong doubled the lead when he robbed the ball in midfield and advanced to score with his left foot.
Jermain Defoe made it 3-0 before half-time finishing from an angle from Adnan Januzaj’s pass, and he added a second moments later.
Palace tried to mount a comeback after the break but Jason Denayer cleared Jason Puncheon’s shot off the line and Vito Mannone came to the rescue for Sunderland.

Romelu Lukaku scored four goals as Everton completed a nine-goal victory over AFC Bournemouth.
James McCarthy struck on 23 minutes, and Lukaku made it 3-0 six minutes later after Simon Francis gifted him the ball.
The visitors fought back back through two goals from Joshua King, on 59 and 70 minutes, but two further strikes by Lukaku, on 83 and 84 minutes, put Everton three clear again.
Harry Arter got another for AFC Bournemouth before Ross Barkley, for the Toffees, completed the goal fest.
Everton report | AFC Bournemouth report

Hull City boosted their prospects of staying up with a 2-0 victory over Liverpool at the KCOM Stadium.
After an early scare when Roberto Firmino was denied by the outstanding Eldin Jakupovic, Hull led on the stroke of half-time through Alfred N'Diaye, who poked the ball in after Simon Mignolet failed to deal with a header.
In a frenetic second half Philippe Coutinho blazed wide from six yards while Abel Hernandez passed up two chances to double Hull’s lead.
But Hull secured the points when, with Liverpool pouring forward, Oumar Niasse powered through on the counter to slide the ball under Mignolet.

Pedro Obiang scored and assisted as West Ham United won a Premier League match at Southampton for the first time since November 2000. 
Manolo Gabbiadini lashed in off the crossbar to give Saints the lead but Andy Carroll's fourth goal in as many matches made it 1-1 after 14 minutes. 
Mark Noble made it 3-1 seven minutes into the second half with a low free-kick that beat Fraser Forster via a deflection off Steven Davis. 
Southampton report | West Ham report

M'Baye Niang inspired Watford to a 2-1 victory over 10-man Burnley on his home Premier League debut. 
The forward signed on loan from Milan last week assisted Troy Deeney's third goal in as many matches as Watford took an early lead. 
The goal came after Jeff Hendrick was sent off for a foul on Jose Holebas.
Burnley's task got tougher when Niang headed in his first Premier League goal before half-time.
Robbie Brady came on for his first Burnley appearance and they pulled one back through Ashley Barnes' penalty after Joey Barton's shot had been handballed by Sebastian Prodl.
Watford are unbeaten in four and move to 10th, with Burnley a point behind in 12th.

James Morrison's fifth goal of the season gave West Bromwich Albion a 1-0 victory over Stoke City. 
Salomon Rondon had a goal ruled out for offside inside four minutes but West Brom were ahead moments later,Morrison finishing neatly after Nacer Chadli's threaded pass. 
Matt Phillips' first-time effort was deflected over and Stoke hit a post from a Charlie Adam corner before half-time. 
Stoke Mark Hughes' men could not salvage a point, with Erik Pieters' mistimed header the closest they came.

Harry Kane's penalty was enough for Tottenham Hotspur to move three points clear of third-placed Arsenal in a 1-0 win over Middlesbrough at White Hart Lane.
Spurs dominated with Victor Valdes in the Middlesbrough goal denying Son Heung-min and Christian Eriksen early on.
Middlesbrough threatened late on, with Marten De Roon firing their best chance wide.
Son Heung-min

Gabriel Jesus scored his first goal in English football as Manchester City took advantage of their rivals dropping points with a 4-0 win away at West Ham United.
The Brazil international assisted Kevin de Bruyne for the opener and tapped home Raheem Sterling's deft pass to claim City's third goal.
David Silva claimed the second goal as the visitors took advantage of slack defending by the hosts.

Eldin Jakupovic was the hero for Hull City as they held Manchester United to a 0-0 draw at Old Trafford.
The Bosnian-born Swiss keeper produced acrobatic saves to deny Paul Pogba, Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Juan Mata either side of the break.

Peter Crouch scored his 100th Premier League goal as Stoke City extended their unbeaten run to four Premier League matches with a 1-1 draw at home to Everton.
Crouch slid in to steer home Marko Arnautovic's centre with only seven minutesEverton goalkeeper Joel Robles did well to twice deny Arnautovic before the Toffees equalised six minutes before half-time when Seamus Coleman's cross was diverted into the net by defender Ryan Shawcross.
Striker Saido Berahino came on to make his Stoke City debut as the home side searched for a winner in the second halfbut Potters goalkeeper Lee Grant saved well from Ademola Lookman and Tom Davies as the sides played out a draw.

Sam Allardyce claimed the first Premier League victory of his Crystal Palace reign at the sixth attempt thanks to headers from Scott Dann and Christian Benteke.
Debutant Patrick van Aanholt blazed a shot over the crossbar and Joshua King and Harry Arter both fired wide for AFC Bournemouth, before Benteke made the points safe for the Eagles from Andros Townsend's cross.

Watford earned their first Premier League away win at Arsenal as two goals in the first 13 minutes set up a 2-1 victory.
Former Tottenham Hotspur defender Younes Kaboul opened the scoring with a powerful drive aided by a deflection off Aaron Ramsey, who limped off with an injury.
Watford's second came three minutes later as Troy Deeney slotted in afterPetr Cech parried Etienne Capoue's shot into his path.
Alex Iwobi slotted in from Alexis Sanchez’s chipped cross on 54 minutes and Lucas Perez crashed an effort against the crossbar as Arsenal piled the pressure on in the second half, but Watford held on.

Sam Vokes scored as Burnley continued their superb home form with a 1-0 victory over Leicester City.
Leicester began brightly with Riyad Mahrez and Robert Huth both going close, before Ashley Barnes fired narrowly wide for the hosts.
Ahmed Musa forced a save from Tom Heaton in the second half as Barnes continued to threaten for Sean Dyche's men.
But Vokes met a late corner and struck his shot into the roof of the net, allowing Burnley to claim their ninth home win of the season.

Middlesbrough and West Bromwich Albion shared the points in a lively 1-1 draw at the Riverside Stadium.
West Brom pushed for a winner after the break, with Matt Phillips, Hal Robson-Kanu and Chris Brunt all being denied by a resolute Boro defence.
Middlesbrough report | West Brom report

Tottenham Hotspur climbed to second in the Premier League table despite being frustrated by Sunderland in a 0-0 stalemate at the Stadium of Light.
Sunderland are 19th.

Gylfi Sigurdsson's scored the decisive goal for the second successive Matchweek as Swansea City beat Southampton 2-1 at the Liberty Stadium. 
Saints brought the fit-again Sofiane Boufal off the bench shortly into the second half and Claude Puel's side were level two minutes later, Shane Long converting Ryan Bertand's low cross at the near post.
Swansea report | Southampton report

Georginio Wijnaldum's header earned Liverpool a 1-1 draw against Chelsea and denied the visitors the chance of an 11-point lead at the top of the Premier League.
Chelsea took the lead on 25 minutes when David Luiz's quickly-taken free-kick eluded Simon Mignolet.
Roberto Firmino missed an opportunity immediately after the break following a kind ricochet in the Chelsea defence, but Jurgen Klopp's side drew level moments later.
A diagonal Jordan Henderson ball was headed back across goal by James Milner and Wijnaldum nodded past Thibaut Courtois.

Southampton ended a four-match losing run in the Premier League with a 3-0 victory over Leicester City.
James Ward-Prowse curled in a first-time effort after Cedric Soares' cutback on 26 minutes, before Jay Rodriguez lashed in from close range after a Ward-Prowse delivery fell to him.
After captain Virgil van Dijk limped off with an injury and Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg dragged wide when clean through, Saints added a third a few minutes from time.
Substitute Shane Long was brought down by Wes Morgan, and Dusan Tadic slammed in the resulting penalty against a Leicester side searching for their first away win of the PL campaign.

Alexis Sanchez earned a last-gasp 2-1 victory for Arsenal as two penalties were scored in stoppage-time.
The Chilean deftly chipped the spot-kick down the middle of the goal following Ben Mee's foul on Laurent Koscielny, three minutes after Burnley's Andre Gray converted as Francis Coquelin tripped Ashley Barnes.
After Burnley resisted Arsenal's pressure in the first half, Skhodran Mustafi headed in from Mesut Ozil's corner with 59 minutes gone.
Granit Xhaka was shown a red card for a lunge on Burnley's Steven Defour, and then Gray netted before Sanchez struck the final blow in th eighth minute of stoppage time.

Goals in either half gave Chelsea a hard-fought victory over Hull City that extends their lead at the top of the Premier League table.
Returning striker Diego Costa, who missed last week's win at Leicester City through injury, opened the scoring in first-half stoppage time when he fired home from a Victor Moses cross.
The home side did not have it all their own way, however, with Chelsea goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois having to save well from Harry Maguire, David Meyler and Oumar Niasse.

Gylfi Sigurdsson scored the winner as Swansea City edged a five-goal thriller to beat Liverpool at Anfield for the first time in the Premier League.
Llorente struck again four minutes later when he met Tom Carroll’s cross with a thumping header.
Liverpool rallied when Roberto Firmino headed in James Milner’s centre on 55 minutes, and the Brazilian struck again on 69 minutes.
Liverpool report | Swansea report

AFC Bournemouth twice come from behind to earn a 2-2 draw with Watford at Vitality Stadium.
The Hornets took the lead from a Jose Holebas corner which Christian Kabasele headed in at the near post from Miguel Britos's knock-back.
AFC Bournemouth equalised after the interval through Joshua King who connected with Adam Smith's fizzing cross.
Troy Deeney met Tom Cleverley’s corner with his head after beating Artur Boruc to the punch.

Seamus Coleman’s 87th-minute goal left Sam Allardyce still awaiting his first win as Crystal Palace manager.
Everton thought they had taken the lead in the first half when Ross Barkley smashed home, but the Englishman was adjudged to have been offside when Romelu Lukaku's initial effort deflected off the post.
But three minutes from time Tom Davies found Coleman with a neat through-ball and the wing-back fired his fourth goal of the season to seal Everton's third PL win on the bounce.

Andy Carroll was at the double as West Ham United made it five wins from seven Premier League matches with a 3-1 victory at Middlesbrough.
After scoring a goal-of-the-season contender against Crystal Palace in Matchweek 21, Carroll opened the scoring with a thunderous header from Manuel Lanzini’s corner.
Boro equalised on 27 minutes when Cristhian Stuani steered home at the back post after Calum Chambers was released down the right wing by Adama Traore.
But just before half-time Carroll restored West Ham’s lead, following up Michail Antonio’s parried effort to net his fifth of the season.
Substitute Jonathan Calleri's first Premier League goal made it 3-1 in stoppage time as Slaven Bilic’s side climbed into the top half of the table.

Wayne Rooney scored a 94th-minute free-kick to become Manchester United's all-time record goalscorer and rescue a point at Stoke City.
United had fallen behind when Juan Mata inadvertently deflected an Erik Pieters cross into his own net.
goalkeeper Lee Grant denied Marouane Felliani and Paul Pogba
United substitute Marcus Rashford came close and Jesse Lingard hit the bar before Rooney struck to stretch United's unbeaten league run to 13 matches.

West Bromwich Albion scored twice in seven first-half minutes to wrap up a comfortable victory which left Sunderland at the bottom of the table.
Darren Fletcher opened the scoring with a crisp volley and Chris Brunt doubled the lead with a fierce shot from 20 yards.
but apart from two half-chances for Jermain Defoe, created little in the first half.
Patrick van Aanholt’sdeflected shot was well saved by Ben Foster after the break before West Brom’s

Tottenham Hotspur came from two goals down at the Etihad Stadium to draw 2-2 with Manchester City.
After a goalless first half, Leroy Sane opened the scoring on 49 minutes as Hugo Lloris missed Kevin De Bruyne's ball over the top.
Four minutes later, Spurs got a goal back through Dele Alli's header from Kyle Walker’s cross.
Shortly after Raheem Sterling had shot straight at Lloris when through on goal, Son Heung-min levelled after Harry Kane's flick.
Gabriel Jesus, on for his debut, thought he had the winner

Mirallas then made it 2-0 after being played in by Ross Barkley shortly after half-time.Morgan Schneiderlin and Lookman came on as substitutes, and the latter scored after John Stones' attempted clearance rebounded into his path.  
Everton remain seventh, nine points adrift of Manchester City.

A close-range header from Zlatan Ibrahimovic with only six minutes to go gave Manchester United a share of the points in a frantic contest against Liverpool.
Liverpool had taken the lead at Old Trafford when James Milner fired home his sixth goal of the season from the penalty spot after Paul Pogba handled a corner in the area.
Manchester United piled on the pressure in the second half as they searched for an equaliser, while David De Gea in the United goal saved well from Roberto Firmino and Adam Lallana.
Ibrahimovic claimed his sixth goal in six Premier League matches when he stooped to head home from Antonio Valencia's cross after Marouane Fellaini's header came back off the post.
Liverpool slip to third, seven points behind leaders Chelsea.

Tottenham Hotspur eased into second in the Premier League with a 4-0 win over West Bromwich Albion, their sixth in a row, thanks to Harry KaneWest Brom emerged more competitive after the break but, despite the departure of Jan Vertonghen through injury, it was Spurs who continued to score.

Joey Barton came off the bench to claim three points for Burnley at Turf Moor with a deflected free-kick.
Defences had been on top before that, with Virgil van Dijk outstanding in the centre of the Southampton rearguard.
But when Burnley won a free-kick 25 yards out, Barton sent it low into the net with 12 minutes left.

A Junior Stanislas penalty had put the visitors ahead with three minutes gone after Harry Maguire fouled Ryan Fraser.
With 62 minutes gone, the ball broke to Tom Huddlestone on the edge of the area, and his shot deflected into the net for a Tyrone Mings own goal.
Hull City report | AFC Bournemouth report

Marko Arnautovic and Peter Crouch were on target as Stoke City completed a 3-1 victory at Sunderland.
Arnautovic first struck on the quarter-hour mark after Vito Mannone had saved his initial shot, and the Austria international doubled his tally seven minutes later after two quickfire one-twos.
Crouch beat Mannone to a hanging cross to head in his 99th Premier League goal before Jermain Defoe raced clear to register his 12th league strike of the season – and 21st in the month of January, two shy of Alan Shearer’s record – five minutes before the break.

Arsenal climbed to third place in the Premier League after a comfortable 4-0 win over Swansea City.
After the break Arsenal’s renewed pressure was rewarded when Alex Iwobi’s shot deflected off Jack Cork, looped over Lukasz Fabianski and into the net.
Alexis Sanchez made it 4-0 on 73 minutes, volleying in from close range.

Watford extended their winless run in the Premier League to six matches following a goalless draw with Middlesbrough at Vicarage Road.
Watford began to threaten after half time and on-loan substitute Tom Cleverley was inches away from a debut goal as his late shot hit the post, while Abdoulaye Doucoure headed wide.
Middlesbrough striker Rudy Gestede also came close to marking his debut with a goal but he shot over as both teams shared the points on an emotional afternoon.

Andy Carroll scored a wonderful goal as West Ham United overcame the absence of Dimitri Payet and recorded their biggest home win of the season against Crystal Palace.
In a quiet first half at London Stadium, James Tomkins missed a chance to give Crystal Palace the lead against his old club as he shot wide from close range.
West Ham controlled the second half and deservedly took the lead when Michail Antonio set up Sofiane Feghouli to score his first Premier League goal.

Chelsea returned to winning ways with a comfortable victory at Leicester City, thanks to two goals by Marcos Alonso and a Pedro header that restored their seven-point lead.
With leading scorer Diego Costa out after Antonio Conte said he had a back injury, Alonso gave his side a sixth-minute lead with a curling finish from Eden Hazard’s layoff.
Pedro produced the third, meeting Willian’s cutback with a looping header.
The win means Chelsea boast two more points than the 50 they earned in the whole of 2015/16.Man of the Match Marcos Alonso

Two headers by Dele Alli earned Tottenham Hotspur a memorable victory over Chelsea at White Hart Lane.had Eden Hazard’s fifth-minute shot not fizzed wide but after Victor Wanyama and Christian Eriksen shot wide from range, Alli met Eriksen’s cross on the stroke of half-time.Chelsea threatened through Diego Costa and Hazard, the latter heading wide from close-range, but Alli made no mistake when invited to score by Eriksen again.

Arsenal came from 3-0 down to snatch a last-gasp draw with AFC Bournemouth.
Callum Wilson put the Cherries 2-0 up after 15 minutes and Ryan Fraser extended the lead 13 minutes after the break.
Alexis Sanchez started the comeback with a header in the 70th minute and then substitute Lucas Perez's left-foot volley made it 3-2.
Simon Francis was then shown a straight red card for a foul on Aaron Ramsey.
Arsenal's pressure paid off in the second minute of stoppage time, when Olivier Giroud glanced in Granit Xhaka's cross.
There was still time for Petr Cech to deny Harry Arter a winner at the other end.

Angel Rangel’s first goal since May 2013 lifted Swansea City off the bottom of the table and earned Paul Clement victory on his first day in charge of the Welsh club.
Swansea had dominated the first half at Selhurst Park and deserved their lead at the break thanks to Alfie Mawson’s first goal for the club.
But Sam Allardyce, in his first home match in charge of Crystal Palace, saw his team fight back and thought they had at least claimed a point through Wilfried Zaha’sBut, with two minutes remaining, Leroy Fer's chipped ball over the top allowed Rangel to score the goal that lifted Swansea above Hull City into 19th and within a point of Palace.

Peter Crouch scored for the second successive match to help Stoke City to a comfortable 2-0 win over Watford.
Ryan Shawcross put Mark Hughes’s side ahead in first-half stoppage time when he volleyed home Charlie Adam’s corner for his first goal in just over two years.
Crouch doubled the lead as he poked in a cross from Adam that had been missed by the Watford defence.
Heurelho Gomes denied Jonathan Walters from scoring Stoke's third while Sebastian Prodl headed past a post for the visitors, who have won once in their past eight Premier League matches.

Leicester City produced a stubborn defensive display to frustrate Middlesbrough in the two teams' opening match of 2017 at the Riverside Stadium.
Chances were at a premium in the opening period, Andy King's free-kick being saved by Boro goalkeeper Brad Guzan and Marten de Roonhaving a shot deflected over.
Boro pressed forward in the second half, with substitute George Friend shooting wide after dribbling through the Foxes defence, while Gaston Ramirez pulled the ball wide from eight yards out after collecting Wes Morgan's clearing header.
King had a late header saved for the visitors as both sides had to settle for a point.

Everton left it late but wore down a resolute Southampton defence to claim a 3-0 win at Goodison Park.
Chances were at a premium until the second half, when Enner Valencia struck from close range on 73 minutes for his first goal for the club.
Eight minutes later Maya Yoshida fouled Valencia in the penalty area and Leighton Baines stepped up to double Everton's lead from the spot.
Missing the suspended Virgil van Dijk, Southampton conceded a third on 89 minutes through Romelu Lukaku's fierce first-time finish.

Substitute Sergio Aguero's second-half strike was the winner for ten-man Manchester City against Burnley at the Etihad Stadium.
Johan Berg Gudmundsson Gael Clichy netted a rare goal in the 58th minute, his right-foot shot finding the bottom corner, before Aguero came on to double City’s lead four minutes later from a tight angle.
Ben Mee gave Burnley hope with a scrambled effort and Andre Gray and Michael Keane both went close as Sean Dyche's team pushed in vain for an equaliser.

Liverpool led at the Stadium of Light when Daniel Sturridge headed Dejan Lovren’s volley past Vito Mannone.
Sunderland equalised through Jermain Defoe’s10th goal of the season, via the penalty spot after Ragnar Klavan's foul on Didier Ndong.
Sadio Mane, in his final match before the African Cup of Nations, scored his ninth of the season to make it 2-1.
But six minutes from time Mane handled Sebastian Larsson’s free-kick, to allow Defoe to equalise for the second time from the spot.
Liverpool remain second, five points behind Chelsea, while Sunderland are 18th and moved to within a point of Crystal Palace.

Gareth McAuley's fourth goal of the season helped West Bromwich Albion come from behind to beat Hull City 3-1 at The Hawthorns.
Hull had not won away in the Premier League since Matchweek 2 but took the lead when Robert Snodgrass volleyed in his seventh goal of the season from Ahmed Elmohamady’s cross.
West Brom's quest for an equaliser was rewarded immediately after the break, with Chris Brunt heading in Matt Phillips’ corner.
James Morrison scored a third in the 73rd minute after Salomon Rondon had diverted Hal Robson-Kanu’s pass into his path.

Juan Mata and Zlatan Ibrahimovic secured Manchester United a sixth league win in a row, winning 2-0 against 10-man West Ham United.
Manchester United almost led when Antonio Valencia shot at Darren Randolph before Jesse Lingard’s follow-up hit a post.
After the break Michail Antonio spurned two chances for West Ham, the second one when through one-on-one.
Two minutes later, two United substitutes combined as Marcus Rashford cut the ball back for Mata to finish.
West Ham drop to 13th on 22 points.

Harry Kane and Dele Alli both scored twice as Tottenham Hotspur began 2017 in style with a dominant 4-1 victory over Watford.
Kane converted Kieran Trippier’s through-ball after 27 minutes, before poking in his 59th PL career goal on his 100th appearance, again assisted by the impressive Trippier.
Alli then made it 3-0 before half-time following a Younes Kaboul error and completed his brace less than a minute into the second half, meeting Kane’s cross for his fifth goal in three matches.
Watford drop below West Ham United to 13th.

Olivier Giroud scored a goal-of-the-season contender as Arsenal beat Crystal Palace 2-0 at Emirates Stadium.
On his second start of the Premier League campaign after his winner against West Bromwich Albion, the Frenchman netted with an astonishing flick from Alexis Sanchez’s cross to rival Henrikh Mkhitaryan’s similar effort for Manchester United in Matchweek 18.
Sanchez twice went close to making it 2-0 before Alex Iwobi headed in Nacho Monreal’s deflected cross for his second goal of the season 11 minutes into the second half.
Palace rallied and tested Petr Cech through Christian Benteke, Yohan Cabaye and Andros Townsend, but the Gunners were deserved victors to move back above Tottenham Hotspur into third place.

An Andre Gray hat-trick fired Burnley to their seventh home win of the Premier League season at the expense of Sunderland.
Sunderland lost both Lamine Kone and Victor Anichebe to injury before Gray completed his hat-trick on 53 minutes, with Ashley Barnes adding a fourth from the penalty spot.
Jermain Defoe's ninth goal of the season was in vain for the Black Cats as Gray become Burnley's first hat-trick scorer in the Premier League.

A Willian brace helped Chelsea beat Stoke City for their 13th consecutive Premier League win to equal Arsenal’s record for most successive victories within the same season.
Gary Cahill opened the scoring from Cesc Fabregas’ 100th Premier League assist – only the fourth player to reach the milestone – before Stoke equalised via Bruno Martins Indi’s first PL goal 56 seconds into the second half.
The Blues made it 2-1 when Willian fired through the crowd after Eden Hazard’s cushioned pass, but Stoke levelled for the second time through Peter Crouch.
Chelsea hit back immediately to take the lead for the third time as Willian rifled into the roof of Lee Grant’s net, while Diego Costa completed the scoring on his return from suspension with his 14th of the season.

Islam Slimani’s first-half header clinched Leicester City's fifth victory of their Premier League title defence.
Marc Albrighton crossed for the Algeria international on 21 minutes and his effort looped over Darren Randolph.
The visitors pushed strongly for an equaliser after the break and Claudio Ranieri's team had plenty of defending to do, with Andy Carroll causing problems.
Aaron Cresswell’s powerful free-kick was deflected but Kaspar Schmeichel managed to keep it out - and the Foxes secured their second league win in 10 matches.

Paul Pogba's 86th-minute header completed a dramatic late turnaround for Manchester United against Middlesbrough.
Before a rollercoaster finale at Old Trafford, Zlatan Ibrahimovic had a goal disallowed and Middlesbrough took the lead when Alvaro Negredo teed up Grant Leadbitter.
goalkeeper Victor Valdes then saved from Ibrahimovic, substitute Marcus Rashford and Anthony Martial on his return to his former club as Jose Mourinho's side piled on the pressure.
’s header flew into the top corner a minute later for United's fifth consecutive PL win.

Hal Robson-Kanu's stunning second-half strike gave West Bromwich Albion victory to move above opponents Southampton to eighth in the Premier League table.
Shane Long gave Saints the lead on 41 minutes with a near-post header from Dusan Tadic's corner, but less than two minutes later the Baggies were all square through Matt Phillips.
The Baggies had lost to Manchester United and Arsenal in their last two but ensured they returned to winning ways as Robson-Kanu fired a wonderful left-footed strike into the top corner.

AFC Bournemouth returned to winning ways with a convincing 3-0 victory at bottom-of-the-table Swansea City.
Benik Afobe opened the scoring for the visitors when he picked up a loose ball after Lukasz Fabianski saved Jordi Amat from diverting the ball into his own net.
The Cherries doubled their lead just before the break when Ryan Fraser bundled the ball home from close range from Junior Stanislas' cross.

A superb header by Georginio Wijnaldum secured victory for second-placed Liverpool against third-placed Manchester City.
The Reds led after eight minutes when Adam Lallana broke on the left and crossed for Dutchman Wijnaldum, whose clinical header found the corner.
David Silva and Raheem Sterling had chances, while Liverpool carried a constant threat on the counterattack.

Ross Barkley's late header cancelled out a wonderful Robert Snodgrass free-kick as Everton fought back to draw 2-2 at Hull City.
The Everton midfielder connected with Leighton Baines' deep cross with six minutes left, after Snodgrass curled a free-kick superbly into the top corner on 65 minutes.
Michael Dawson rifled in his third goal of the season to put Hull 1-0 up on six minutes, before goalkeeper David Marshall deflected a corner into his own net for Everton's equaliser in first-half stoppage time.
Not long after hitting the post with another superb set piece, Snodgrass put Hull 2-1 up, but Everton's pressure was rewarded late on. Everton remain seventh.

Dele Alli scored twice as Tottenham Hotspur ended their winless run away from home with a come-from-behind victory at Southampton.
Saints had the perfect start when Virgil van Dijk headed in from James Ward-Prowse's free-kick after only 69 seconds.
But Spurs equalised on 19 minutes with Alli's header from a deflected cross before Harry Kane headed home his eighth goal of the campaign from a Christian Eriksen corner early in the second half.
Nathan Redmond was dismissed for a foul on Alli in the area but Kane's resulting penalty was fired over the bar when the turf gave way under his standing foot.

Liverpool moved back into second place in the Premier League after an emphatic victory over Stoke City at Anfield.
The Potters took the lead after 12 minutes when Jonathan Walters headed in Erik Pieters’ cross and Joe Allen was then denied by Simon Mignolet.
But Liverpool took control after Adam Lallana levelled from a tight angle on 34 minutes and Roberto Firmino, who had twice threatened, struck a minute before half-time, sending an angled drive in off both posts.
Giannelli Imbula turned Divock Origi’s cross into his own net on 59 minutes and substitute Daniel Sturridge Liverpool report | Stoke report

Troy Deeney prevented Sam Allardyce from enjoying a winning start at Crystal Palace with a late penalty for Watford in a 1-1 draw at Vicarage Road.
Yohan Cabaye's smart finish from Andros Townsend’s through-ball gave Allardyce's team a half-time lead that could have been two goals, but Christian Benteke’s penalty was saved by Heurelho Gomes after the Watford goalkeeper had brought the Belgian down.
But Watford, who had been disrupted by two early forced injury substitutions, improved in the second half and equalised through Deeney's 71st-minute penalty, awarded for Damien Delaney’s foul on Sebastian Prodl at a corner.
Ahead of the other matches, the point lifted Watford to 10th while Crystal Palace were unable to distance themselves from the bottom three.

Olivier Giroud's 86th-minute goal earned Arsenal a 1-0 victory over a resilient West Bromich Albion side at Emirates Stadium. 
After the break, Ben Foster made two remarkable saves to deny Arsenal as Alexis Sanchez also struck a post from close range.
Claudio Yacob skied a shot over the bar from six yards before Giroud latched on to Mesut Ozil’s cross to head Arsenal to victory.

Burnley clinched a sixth Premier League home win of the season courtesy of Andre Gray’s instinctive finish on 80 minutes against Middlesbrough.
Alvaro Negredo fired in an early close range strike but the Boro forward's effort was disallowed for an earlier infringement.
Victor Valdes twice came to the rescue for Middlesbrough, tipping an Ashley Barnes header around a post and keeping out a long-range George Boyd shot.

A fine Pedro performance and Eden Hazard’s 50th Premier League goal earned Chelsea a club-record 12th successive victory in the competition with a 3-0 defeat of AFC Bournemouth.
Pedro had given Chelsea the lead with a curled effort from 18 yards supplied by Cesc Fabregas’ 98th Premier League assist, before Hazard scored a penalty in the 49th minute after he was fouled by Simon Francis.
AFC Bournemouth were dangerous throughout and twice went close through Jack Wilshere and substitute Benik Afobe, but Antonio Conte’smen got a late third when Steve Cook deflected in Pedro's shot.

Kevin Mirallas scored for the third Premier League match in a row against Leicester City before Romelu Lukaku's stoppage-time goal sealed a 2-0 win for Everton.
Leonardo Ulloa’s header 15 minutes later.
Everton have lost only two of their last 14 PL matches against the reigning champions.

Zlatan Ibrahimovic continued his goalscoring run as Manchester United claimed a fourth straight Premier League win at the expense of Sunderland.
Daley Blind broke the deadlock with his first Premier League goal of the season after some fine build-up play involving Marcos Rojo and Ibrahimovic.
United took control of the second half and doubled their lead when Ibrahimovic finished past Jordan Pickford, taking his tally to eight goals in seven Premier League appearances.
The Swede turned provider for Henrikh Mkhitaryan, who added a third with a spectacular flick, before Fabio Borini's fine strike pulled a goal back in stoppage time for Sunderland, who remain in the bottom three.

West Ham United extended their winning run to three Premier League matches with a convincing victory at Swansea City.
Andre Ayew put West Ham ahead against his former club with a tap-in from close range on 13 minutes.
Winston Reid doubled the lead on 50 minutes, heading in Dimitri Payet’s corner.
West Ham took control as Michail Antonio added a third but Swansea pulled a goal back through substitute Fernando Llorente in the 89th minute.
But any hopes of a comeback were ended a minute later by Andy Carroll, who volleyed in for West Ham to move eight points clear of the bottom three.

Manchester City moved up to second in the Premier League with a hard-fought 3-0 victory at Hull City, with all goals coming in the last 20 minutes.
Yaya Toure opened the scoring, sending David Marshall the wrong way with a 72nd-minute penalty, before Kelechi Iheanacho tapped in from David Silva's cross six minutes later.
The victory was wrapped up when Curtis Davies diverted Raheem Sterling's shot into his own net in the final moments. 
Hull were a match for Man City in the first half and went close to taking the lead on 58 minutes when Michael Dawson’s looping header was cleared off the line by Bacary Sagna, but the defeat means they remain bottom of the table.

Sadio Mane struck a stoppage-time goal to claim victory for Liverpool in the Merseyside derby.
In a frenetic first half at Goodison Park, dominated by an industrious home side, Ramires Funes Mori had the best chance, steering a free header wide from an Everton corner.
After the break Liverpool were in the ascendancy, with Roberto Firmino denied when through on goal by Maarten Stekelenburg, who later went off injured.
Funes Mori had another headed chance but directed it straight at Simon Mignolet, while Stekelenburg’s replacement, Joel Robles, saved well from Firmino’s volley.
The winner came in the fourth minute of added time when Mane reacted fastest to Daniel Sturridge’s shot hitting a post.
Everton are ninth.

Two second-half goals from Jay Rodriguez gave Southampton a come-from-behind derby victory over AFC Bournemouth at Vitality Stadium, to lift them to seventh.
AFC Bournemouth took an early lead when Nathan Ake headed homeJack Wilshere's cross after six minutes.
Southampton replied soon afterwards, Ryan Bertrand firing across goal for a fine finish just inside the far post after 14 minutes.
Three minutes after half-time Rodriguez slid in to score from close range after a run and cross from substitute Steven Davis.
Rodriguez sealed the three points on 85 minutes with a superb strike from just outside the penalty area.

Manchester City came from behind to beat Arsenal 2-1 and move above them, into second place.
Theo Walcott fired Arsenal ahead at the Etihad Stadium on five minutes, from Alexis Sanchez’s through-ball.
Leroy Sane converted David Silva’s chip over the defence two minutes after the restart.
Petr Cech denied Sane a second on 61 minutes but City’s winner came on 71 minutes when Raheem Sterling, found out wide by Kevin De Bruyne, cut inside and beat Cech at his near post.

Tottenham Hotspur closed the gap on the top four by coming from behind to beat Burnley 2-1 at White Hart Lane.
didn’t last long, Dele Alli converting Kyle Walker’s cross five minutes later.
Harry Kane almost put Spurs ahead before the break but Tom Heaton’s leg saved his shot.

Chelsea recorded a club record 11th consecutive Premier League win with a 1-0 victory at Crystal Palace.
Diego Costa’s league-leading 13th goal of the campaign two minutes before half-time was enough to extend the Blues’ lead at the top of the table to nine points.
Marcos Alonso rattled the crossbar with a free-kick in the second half as Chelsea, with their ninth clean sheet in 11 matches, held on for a slender win, leaving Alan Pardew’s side on 15 points from 17 matches.
Man of the match: Cesar Azpilicueta

Alvaro Negredo’s brace helped Middlesbrough return to winning ways as they beat Swansea City 3-0 at the Riverside.
The striker broke the deadlock on 18 minutes, converting Adam Clayton’s cross past Lukasz Fabianski.
He doubled the lead from the penalty spot 11 minutes later after Jordi Amat’s foul on Adam Forshaw.

Ten-man Leicester City mounted a second-half comeback to secure a 2-2 draw with Stoke City.
Leicester were level when Daniel Amartey’s glanced in Christian Fuchs's cross two minutes from time.

Patrick van Aanholt scored his third goal of the season to give Sunderland their third win in four home matches as they beat Watford 1-0.
The left-back expertly controlled Jermain DefoeDavid Moyes’s side will be grateful to goalkeeper Jordan Pickford who denied Nordin Amrabat, Daryl Janmaat and Odion Ighalo as Watford piled on the pressure.
Troy Deeney headed wide as Sunderland held firm to move off the bottom of the table to 18th, and within a point of safety.

Mark Noble scored his second match-winning penalty for West Ham United in four days as they beat Hull City at London Stadium.
The West Ham captain followed up Wednesday’s spot-kick against Burnley by sending David Marshall the wrong way from the spot after Tom Huddlestone had fouled Michail Antonio.
Hull will feel unlucky to have left with no points after hitting the woodwork three times through Dieumerci Mbokani, Noble, on his own goal, and Andrew Robertson.
Harry Maguire also had an effort cleared off the line by Edimilson Fernandes while Robert Snodgrass drove just over as the defeat put Hull at the bottom of the table.

Zlatan Ibrahimovic continued his fine form with two goals for Manchester United that were enough to beat West Bromwich Albion.
Wayne Rooney almost doubled the score but his fierce shot was tipped on to the bar by Ben Foster, while Salomon Rondon’s first-half header went narrowly wide for West Brom.
Ibrahimovic produced his 11th Premier League goal of the season when he received Rooney’s pass, turned and saw his deflected shot go in.

Adam Lallana was involved in all three goals as Liverpool earned a 3-0 victory at Middlesbrough.
The midfielder opened the scoring with a towering header after Nathaniel Clyne’s superb cross, before turning provider for Divock Origi to score for the fifth consecutive match.
And Origi returned the favour eight minutes later as he centred for Lallana, who slotted in from close range.

A first-half strike from Cesc Fabregas earned Chelsea a 1-0 win over Sunderland as they moved six points clear at the top of the Premier League.
The Spain midfielder netted his first goal of the season from 18 yards to hand Chelsea a 10th straight league win.
Adnan Januzaj had gone close to giving Sunderland the lead at Stadium of Light before Pedro was denied by Jordan Pickford.
Willian nearly doubled their lead but hit the crossbar before another grazed the post.

Mark Noble's first-half goal proved enough for West Ham United to claim three points against Burnley at London Stadium.
The Hammers captain had gone close with a long-range effort before Ben Mee fouled Winston Reid in the penalty area in first-half stoppage time.
Manuel Lanzini went close to doubling West Ham's lead, and Darren Randolph beat away a Scott Arfield free-kick as West Ham endured some pressure.
visitors pressed hard for an equaliser after half-time, with Sam Vokes missing several chances, but the Hammers held out for their fourth league win, climbing two places to 15th.

Zlatan Ibrahimovic scored a late winner as Manchester United beat Crystal Palace to claim back-to-back Prermier League wins for the first time since August.
Paul Pogba gave Jose Mourinho's side the lead just before half-time when he converted Ibrahimovic's flick on from close range, having seen an earlier strike saved by Wayne Hennessey.
David De Gea preserved the lead with an excellent stop to deny James McArthur but the Palace midfielder equalised shortly after with a cool finish from Damien Delaney's back-heel.

Goals from Pablo Zabaleta and David Silva helped Manchester City return to winning ways against Watford at Etihad Stadium.
Pep Guardiola's side controlled the early stages and went close to taking the lead but both Kevin de Bruyne and Nolito were thwarted by Heurelho Gomes.
After Zabaleta's first Premier League goal of the season, City stepped up the tempo, despite losing Ilkay Gundogan to injury, as Raheem Sterling saw a superb effort hit the crossbar.
Watford's best chance fell to Etienne Capoue, who was denied at close range by Claudio Bravo.

Ten-man Stoke played out a goalless draw against Southampton after Marko Arnautovic was dismissed early on at the bet365 Stadium.
The Austria international received a straight red card from referee Anthony Taylor for a high challenge on Sofiane Boufal on 20 minutes.
James Ward-Prowse and Nathan Redmond also had chances for the visitors, with Lee Grant by far the busier goalkeeper, but Southampton could not find a way through.

Tottenham Hotspur remain unbeaten at home in the Premier League this season after Christian Eriksen inspired victory over Hull City.
The Dane slotted home Danny Rose’s 14th minute cutback to cap a fine 30-pass move.Eriksen added a second from close range after the break before Victor Wanyama confirmed victory late on.
Salomon Rondon became the second man to score a headed hat-trick in the Premier League as West Bromwich Albion beat Swansea City 3-1.

Marc Pugh marked his first Premier League start of the season with a winning goal as AFC Bournemouth beat champions Leicester City at Vitality Stadium.
The midfielder opened his account for the season with a sweetly-struck volley from Benik Afobe's rebounded effort and his goal was the difference as Leicester could not make the most of their second-half chances. 
Leicester threatened to take an early lead when Jamie Vardy had a shot cleared off the line but AFC Bournemouth led at the break thanks to Pugh's first goal since April.
The Foxes twice went close through Robert Huth before Leonardo Ulloa had a shot spectacularly saved by Artur Boruc in stoppage time, but the Cherries held on to move into the top half of the table.

Ashley Williams scored his first goal for Everton to give his side a late victory over Arsenal at Goodison Park.
Everton went behind on 20 minutes when Alexis Sanchez's free-kick deflected off Williams and into the net.
The home side rallied and restored parity just before the break through Seamus Coleman's glancing header from Leighton Baines' cross.
Everton's Dominic Calvert-Lewin came on for his Premier League debut and Ronald Koeman's men took the lead four minutes from time when Williams headed home from a corner. 
In a frantic finish, Phil Jagielka was sent off for a second yellow card while Alex Iwobi had a shot cleared off the line as Arsenal suffered their first league defeat since the opening day of the season.

Diego Costa's league-leading 12th goal of the season extended Chelsea’s Premier League winning streak to nine and returned them to the top of the table with a 1-0 victory over West Bromwich Albion.
The home team had dominated possession but had registered just one shot on target before Costa’s goal.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan’s first Premier League goal was the difference as Manchester United overcame Tottenham Hotspur with their first win in four Premier League matches.
Victor Wanyama might have levelled after the break, but sent his free header from six yards wide.
Paul Pogba twice threatened to score a second but was denied by the bar, then Hugo Lloris.

Sofiane Boufal’s second-half strike earned Claude Puel’s men a narrow win over Middlesbrough at St Mary’s Stadium.
The Morocco international scored his first Premier League goal on 53 minutes with a fierce strike from distance after a pass from James Ward-Prowse.
Middlesbrough, playing largely on the counter-attack, responded by bringing on Adama Traore, but it was the hosts who came closest to scoring again when Jay Rodriguez's header was cleared off the line by Adam Clayton.
The win takes Southampton's points tally to 20 and lifts them to 10th in the table.

Liverpool and West Ham earned a point each following an engaging draw at Anfield.
Jurgen Klopp’s side took the lead after five minutes when Adam Lallana converted Sadio Mane’s cross from eight yards.
The visitors levelled on 27 minutes when Dimitri Payet curled a 25-yard free-kick into the bottom corner.
Joel Matip headed against the bar on the stroke of half-time, but Liverpool were on terms on 47 minutes when Divock Origi pounced on Darren Randolph’s error.
West Ham are 17th with 13.

Stefano Okaka’s first two goals for Watford inspired a 3-2 comeback victory over Everton at Vicarage Road.
After Romelu Lukaku put Everton in front from a pinpoint pass by Gareth Barry, who was on his 609th Premier League appearance, Okaka levelled with a superb backheel from Nordin Amrabat’s cross.
Jose Holebas provided two assists as Watford went 3-1 up after half-time.
Sebastian Prodl nodded in his left-wing free-kick before Okaka glanced in a header from the defender’s 64th-minute corner.
Lukaku headed in Aaron Lennon's cross as Everton fought back late on, but Watford held on to move a point above Ronald Koeman's side before Saturday’s 3pm matches.
See: Watford report | Everton report

Arsenal came from behind to claim a 3-1 victory over Stoke City at Emirates Stadium.
It was a difficult start for Arsenal, who lost Shkodran Mustafi to injury on 25 minutes before Charlie Adam put the visitors in front with a penalty after Granit Xhaka’s foul on Joe Allen.
Hector Bellerin returned from injury in Mustafi’s place and crossed for Theo Walcott, who volleyed in the equaliser from close range on 42 minutes.
Mesut Ozil put Arsenal in front with a clever looping header over Stoke goalkeeper Lee Grant before Alex Iwobi slotted in after Alexis Sanchez’s surging run, leaving Arsene Wenger’s side above Chelsea on goals scored.

Burnley continued their fine home form with a 3-2 victory over AFC Bournemouth at Turf Moor.
Jeff Hendrick first lashed in a stunning half-volley from distance before Stephen Ward bundled in a second.
Afobe turned in Simon Francis’s cross in first-half stoppage time to halve the lead but George Boyd again extended it with a drilled low finish.
Charlie Daniels smashed past Tom Heaton late on but it was not enough as Burnley won at home for the fifth time this season.

Frazier Campbell struck in the 89th minute to save a point for Crystal Palace in a thrilling 3-3 draw at Hull City.
Hull went ahead through Robert Snodgrass’s penalty in the 27th minute, but Palace struck back twice through Christian Benteke’s spot-kick and Wilfried Zaha’s shot from distance.
Adama Diomande’s fine turn and finish drew Hull level and the hosts thought they had won it when Jake Livermore found the bottom corner 12 minutes from time to make it 3-2.

Goals from Gyfli Sigurdsson and Fernando Llorente, who scored twice, earned Swansea City a 3-0 home win over Sunderland.
Sigurdsson netted from the penalty spot after Jason Denayer had handled Wayne Routledge’s cross.The Icelander turned provider as his corner was shot home by Llorente three minutes later.

Jamie Vardy and Leicester City returned to form in style with a 4-2 victory over Manchester City.
Aleksandar Kolarov’s free-kick and Nolito’s close-range finish prevented Pep Guardiola suffering his heaviest defeat as a coach.

Gaston Ramirez scored the only goal as Middlesbrough beat Hull City at the Riverside Stadium.
Viktor Fischer’s corner.
The closest Hull came to scoring was in stoppage time when Adama Diomande’s shot was tipped wide and, from the resulting corner, the ball went through the Boro six-yard box without a final touch.
Man of the match Gaston Ramirez

Nathan Ake scored in stoppage-time as AFC Bournemouth hit back from 3-1 down to beat Liverpool 4-3 at the Vitality Stadium.
Liverpool were two goals ahead with 14 minutes of normal time left, but substitute Ryan Fraser curled in his first Premier League goal, centre-back Steve Cook brilliantly controlled and volleyed in the equaliser before Ake bundled in from close-range.
’s visitors raced into a two-goal lead inside 22 minutes, with Sadio Mane prodding in the opener following EmreCan’s ball over the top before Divock Origi beat onrushing goalkeeper Artur Boruc and curled into an empty net from a tight angle.
Callum Wilson netted AFC Bournemouth’s first goal before Can curled in a fine third for Liverpool, but Eddie Howe’s home side fought back to earn a classic victory in the third minute of added time.

Leighton Baines kept his cool from the penalty spot with only two minutes left to seal a dramatic draw against Manchester United.
Ander Herrera hit the post after the break, while David De Gea saved from Kevin Mirallas, before Baines converted from 12 yards after Marouane Fellaini fouled Idrissa Gueye in the penalty box late on.
United remain in sixth place after their fourth draw in five matches, one point and two places ahead of Everton, who are without a victory in four fixtures.

Chelsea rallied from a goal down to beat Manchester City 3-1 and stretch their winning sequence to eight Premier League matches.
Chelsea fell behind on the stroke of half-time when Gary Cahill deflected Jesus Navas’s cross over Thibaut Courtois.
Shortly after Kevin De Bruyne missed a glorious chance to double City's lead, Chelsea were level.
Diego Costa scored his 11th goal with a turn and shot on the hour and 10 minutes later Willian put Chelsea alead, celebrating by holding aloft an armband honouring the victims of the Chapecoense air disaster.

Crystal Palace ended a six-match losing streak with a 3-0 victory over Southampton at Selhurst Park.
An error from Southampton goalkeeper Fraser Forster from a backpass gifted Christian Benteke the opening goal on 33 minutes.
Less than three minutes later Palace had doubled their lead, when James Tomkins converted from close range from an Andros Townsend corner.
Southampton had more possession and shots but could not reduce the lead and victory for Palace was confirmed when Benteke got his second, tapping in Jason Puncheon’s cross five minutes before the end.
The win, with Palace’s first clean sheet of the season, lifted them out of the bottom three on 14 points, three behind Southampton.
