Burnley made sure of the win when Wood set up Barnes after Asmir Begovic had spilled a left-wing cross.
AFC Bournemouth report | Burnley report

Jamie Vardy scored twice as Leicester City's resurgence continued with a fourth successive win, easing past Huddersfield Town 4-1 at the John Smith's Stadium.
Leicester took the lead on 24 minutes through Youri Tielemans' right-footed shot, which looped over Ben Hamer.
Huddersfield Town quickly pulled a goal back through Aaron Mooy from the spot after Caglar Soyuncu had fouled Karlan Grant. 
But Leicester rallied, with James Maddison curling in a free-kick on 79 minutes before Vardy scored from the spot with six minutes remaining for his seventh goal in his last six PL appearances.
Huddersfield Town remain bottom on 14 points.

Luka Milivojevic’s 81st-minute penalty gave Crystal Palace all three points against Newcastle United and moved them closer to safety.
men edged a tight match at St James’ Park with Milivojevic scoring from the spot after DeAndre Yedlin’s foul on Wilfried Zaha.
Both sides had first-half goals disallowed, with Newcastle's Salomon Rondon and Palace's James Tomkins denied by offside decisions.
Newcastle went close through a header on 53 minutes from Florian Lejeune, who later was carried off with a knee injury.
Newcastle report | Crystal Palace report

Mohamed Salah ended a six-match Premier League goal drought as Liverpool returned to the top of the table after coming from behind to earn a late 3-1 win at Southampton.
Shane Long put the Saints ahead on nine minutes, when he controlled a flick-on header by Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg to fire in his 50th Premier League goal.
Liverpool added a third six minutes later, when Roberto Firmino played in substitute Jordan Henderson to finish.
Southampton report | Liverpool report

Chelsea moved to fifth in the table with a 3-0 victory over Brighton & Hove Albion at Stamford Bridge. 
Olivier Giroud opened the scoring on 38 minutes by meeting a low cross from Callum Hudson-Odoi, making his first league start.
Eden Hazard doubled their advantage on the hour, curling the ball into the bottom corner from the edge of the area.
The Belgian turned provider for Ruben Loftus-Cheek, who produced a similar finish three minutes later. 
Bernardo came closest to scoring for Brighton but his shot was saved by Kepa Arrizabalaga with 10 minutes to play. 
Chelsea report | Brighton report

Manchester City returned to the top of the Premier League with a comfortable 2-0 victory over Cardiff City at Etihad Stadium.
Kevin De Bruyne gave the champions the lead on six minutes, taking Aymeric Laporte's pass down the left channel and scoring with a fierce shot from a narrow angle. 
Leroy Sane fired into the bottom corner for his ninth league goal of the season.
Man City report | Cardiff report

Second-half goals from Son Heung-min and Christian Eriksen got Tottenham Hotspur off to a winning start at their new stadium by beating Crystal Palace 2-0.
Eriksen confirmed the win 10 minutes from time when he drove a loose ball into the net after a driving run from Harry Kane.
Palace rallied late on and Hugo Lloris saved from Patrick van Aanholt and Wilfried Zaha before Christian Benteke headed wide from close range.
| Crystal Palace report

The Hornets took the lead on 23 minutes when Abdoulaye Doucoure evaded challenges from the Fulham backline to fire in from the edge of the penalty area.
Fulham equalised 10 minutes later, Ryan Sessegnon's disguised through-ball finding Ryan Babel, who rounded Ben Foster to slot home.
Will Hughes hit a spectacular volley to put Watford ahead again on 63 minutes before Troy Deeney added a third six minutes later.
Watford's win was confirmed on 75 minutes when Kiko Femenia connected with Andre Gray's pass.
Watford report | Fulham report

Wolverhampton Wanderers damaged 10-man Manchester United's top-four aspirations with a 2-1 comeback victory at Molineux.
Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side were targeting third place in the table and were rewarded for early pressure when Fred's pass enabled Scott McTominay to turn and arrow a long-range effort into the far-left corner after 13 minutes for his first PL goal.
But 12 minutes later, Wolves were level when a defensive error led to Raul Jimenez clipping in a pass for Diogo Jota, who struck past David De Gea.
Rui Patricio kept out McTominay's close-range header before Man Utd's Ashley Young was sent off after receiving a second yellow card.

Aaron Ramsey and Alexandre Lacazette scored in each half as Arsenal beat Newcastle United 2-0 to move up to third place in the Premier League table.
Lacazette secured the Gunners' 10th successive Premier League home victory with seven minutes left when he chipped Martin Dubravka from substitute Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang’s headed pass.
Ki Sung-yeung had the Magpies’ best chance when he curled a shot wide.
Arsenal report | Newcastle report

Ruben Loftus-Cheek's stoppage-time winner sealed a dramatic, late turnaround for Chelsea at Cardiff City.
Victor Camarasa's classy second-half strike had looked set to secure a precious victory for Cardiff, before headers by Cesar Azpilicueta and Loftus-Cheek saved Maurizio Sarri's side.
In a goalless first-half, Pedro curled a shot over and Willian went close with a free-kick for Chelsea, while Josh Murphy flashed an angled shot narrowly wide at the other end.
A minute after half-time, Harry Arter crossed low and Camarasa calmly clipped in a first-time finish.
Eden Hazard's introduction from the bench bolstered Chelsea's attack and Azpilicueta's late header fromMarcos Alonso's 84th-minute flick-on brought them level.
Cardiff report | Chelsea report

Liverpool returned to the top of the Premier League after a dramatic 90th-minute Toby Alderweireld own goal sealed victory over Tottenham Hotspur at Anfield.
Jurgen Klopp's men went in front on 16 minutes when Andrew Robertson swung in a perfect cross for Roberto Firmino to head beyond Hugo Lloris.
Sadio Mane also curled a shot just wide and while Liverpool regularly poured forward, Spurs provided a threat at the other end.
With 20 minutes left Harry Kane released Kieran Trippier with a quick free-kick and the ball broke to Lucas Moura, who hammered in a low shot for the equaliser.
But Liverpool snatched victory in the closing stages when Lloris parried a Mohamed Salah header on to Alderweireld and the ball rolled across the line.

First-half goals from Bernardo Silva and Sergio Aguero earned Manchester City a 2-0 win at Fulham to return them to the top of the Premier League. 
A misplaced pass from Joe Bryan fell to Silva.Ederson denied Ryan Sessegnon as Fulham got behind City's defence for the first time.
After the break, Raheem Sterling's shot was kept out by Rico.The winger then set up Kyle Walker, but the full-back's effort hit the post. 
Fulham report |

A second-half strike from Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg moved Southampton five points clear of the relegation zone as they won 1-0 at Brighton & Hove Albion.
Southampton almost doubled their lead but Ryan Bertrand's first-time effort was cleared from the goalline by Lewis Dunk.
Brighton report | Southampton report

A quick free-kick freed Chris Wood and his shot hit a post and went in off Conor Coady.
Wolves improved after the break and James Tarkowski and Ben Mee were forced to block close-range efforts from Diogo Jota.
Burnley secured the win on 77 minutes, when McNeil powered forward and fired into the bottom corner.
Burnley report

Huddersfield Town were relegated from the Premier League after a 2-0 defeat at Crystal Palace combined with victories for Southampton and Burnley to send them down.
Andros Townsend then Wilfried Zaha could not score when each were put through on goal.
But their persistence paid off in the 71st minute when Juninho Bacuna brought downZaha and Luka Milivojevic slotted home his ninth penalty goal of the season.
Patrick van Aanholt doubled the lead late on to secure the win. 
Palace report | Huddersfield report

Goals in each half from Wes Morgan and Jamie Vardy helped Leicester City record a 2-0 win over AFC Bournemouth.
Vardy missed an excellent chance to make it 2-0 after 35 minutes, dragging his close-range shot wide.
But the Leicester forward extended the home side’s lead with eight minutes remaining, heading in Youri Tielemans’ right-wing cross to secure Leicester’s first Premier League victory over the Cherries.
Leicester report | AFC Bournemouth report

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer celebrated becoming Manchester United’s permanent manager with a 2-1 win against Watford.
Man Utd opened the scoring against the run of play after 28 minutes, with Luke Shaw’s through-ball finding Marcus Rashford, who finished past Ben Foster.
Watford continued to dominate in the second half, Gerard Deulofeu twice forcing David De Gea into saves, while Will Hughes curled wide.
Anthony Martial scrambled the ball in from substitute Jesse Lingard’s cross.
Man Utd report | Watford report

Everton took the lead after five minutes when Kurt Zouma headed in Gylfi Sigurdsson's corner.
They extended their lead 12 minutes before half-time, with Seamus Coleman sliding the ball across goal for Bernard to tap in his first Premier League goal.
Dominic Calvert-Lewin was twice unable to add to Everton’s lead during the second half, while Richarlison hit the bar as West Ham saw their six-match unbeaten home run come to an end.
West Ham report | Everton report

James Milner's late penalty sent Liverpool back to the top of the Premier League as he sealed a hard-fought 2-1 victory at Fulham.
The Senegalese started and finished a flowing move, directing Roberto Firmino's cutback past Sergio Rico for his ninth league goal in his last nine appearances.
Liverpool failed to convert a series of chances, before Scott Parker's side were rewarded for their persistence when former Reds winger Ryan Babel capitalised upon a defensive mix-up to tap in from close range on 74 minutes during his 100th Premier League match.
Rico spilt Mohamed Salah's shot before fouling Mane when chasing the rebound.
Fulham report | Liverpool report

Everton dented Chelsea's hopes of UEFA Champions League qualification with a 2-0 triumph at Goodison Park courtesy of goals from Richarlison and Gylfi Sigurdsson.
Chelsea dominated the opening stages, with Eden Hazard curling a shot on to the post, but missed a series of chances.
Marco Silva’s side punished the west Londoners when Dominic Calvert-Lewin’s header was parried by Chelsea goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga.Richarlison reacted first to head in on 49 minutes for his 12th league goal of the season. 
Jordan Pickford, making his 100th Premier League appearance, denied Gonzalo Higuain with a smart reaction save, before Everton doubled their lead.
Richarlison beat Marcos Alonso to a loose ball and drew a foul in the penalty area.Everton report | Chelsea report

A stunning stoppage-time equaliser from Matt Ritchie earned Newcastle United a 2-2 draw with AFC Bournemouth at Vitality Stadium
Salomon Rondon put Newcastle ahead in first-half stoppage time with a brilliant free-kick for his ninth Premier League goal of the season.
Just three minutes after the break, AFC Bournemouth were level through Joshua King's penalty, after a foul on Nathan Ake.
AFC Bournemouth report | Newcastle report

Substitute Wes Morgan scored a 90th-minute winner as 10-man Leicester City overcame Burnley 2-1 at Turf Moor. 
Harry Maguire was dismissed after just four minutes having fouled Johann Berg Gudmundsson when he was through on goal. 
James Maddison put Leicester in front with a sublime free-kick, but Dwight McNeil drew Burnley level seven minutes before the break with a smart finish. 
Jack Cork and Chris Wood both fired over as Burnley looked to go ahead before Morgan headed in Youri Tielemans' cross. 
Burnley report | Leicester report

Mark Noble put the Hammers in front from the penalty spot on 15 minutes after Aaron Rowe, on his debut, had fouled Manuel Lanzini. 
Juninho Bacuna headed in Aaron Mooy's corner to level the scores before Karlan Grant put the Terriers ahead on the half-hour.
Grant extended the lead after the break with a superb strike before Angelo Ogbonna pulled a goal back, heading in Aaron Cresswell's corner. 
West Ham report | Huddersfield Town report

Roberto Firmino and Sadio Mane both scored twice as Liverpool came from behind to defeat Burnley 4-2 at Anfield.
But the hosts rallied, Firmino tapping in the equaliser after Mohamed Salah's cross reached him 13 minutes later.
Liverpool report | Burnley report

Eden Hazard's spectacular stoppage-time strike grabbed a point for Chelsea as they drew 1-1 with Wolverhampton Wanderers at Stamford Bridge.
Chelsea report |

Goals from Granit Xhaka and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang handed Ole Gunnar Solskjaer his first Premier League defeat in charge of Manchester United as Arsenal took over fourth from their opponents.
After the break, Marcus Rashford flashed a free-kick narrowly wide and Bernd Leno saved well from Lukaku.
Arsenal report |

Anthony Knockaert scored a superb winner to give Brighton & Hove Albion a 2-1 victory at rivals Crystal Palace.
The home side equalised from the penalty spot five minutes into the second half, after Davy Propper fouled Andros Townsend.Luka Milivojevic sent Mat Ryan the wrong way for his ninth goal of the season.
Crystal Palace report | Brighton report

Junior Hoilett and Victor Camarasa struck to hand Cardiff City a 2-0 victory over West Ham United and end a three-match losing run.
Hoilett gave Cardiff a great start, sweeping home Josh Murphy’s right-wing cross on four minutes.
West Ham responded and came closest on 71 minutes when Declan Rice’s low effort hit a post.
Cardiff report | West Ham report

After six matches out injured, Callum Wilson had the first chance, but saw his low shot saved by Jonas Lossl.
But Wilson was not denied on 20 minutes, when he chested in Ryan Fraser's fierce cross for his 11th league goal of the season.
Huddersfield report | AFC Bournemouth report

Jamie Vardy scored twice to hand Brendan Rodgers his first win as Leicester City manager, beating Fulham 3-1.
Leicester led on 21 minutes when Vardy unselfishly played in Youri Tielemans for his first PL goal.
Half-time substitute Floyd Ayite converted Fulham's first shot on target to level the scores.
But Leicester restored their lead 12 minutes from time when Vardy scored his 100th goal for them, collecting James Maddison's through-ball.
He got his second four minutes from time from Harvey Barnes' pass.
Leicester report | Fulham report

Ayoze Perez scored twice as Newcastle United recovered from 2-0 down at half-time to beat Everton 3-2.
Dominic Calvert-Lewin headed the visitors into an 18th-minute lead.
On the half-hour Salomon Rondon was fouled in the area by Jordan Pickford, who saved the penalty from Matt Ritchie.
Within a minute, Richarlison had doubled Everton’s lead from close range.
Perez set up Rondon to pull one back on 65 minutes before putting the scores level, following up after Miguel Almiron’s shot had been saved.
The Spaniard hit the winner six minutes from time after good work by Isaac Hayden and Rondon.
Newcastle report | Everton report

James Ward-Prowse scored a superb late free-kick as Southampton hit back from a goal down to beat Tottenham Hotspur.
Harry Kane had put Spurs ahead in the 26th minute after a pass from Dele Alli, playing his first match since January.
Three minutes after coming on, substitute Stuart Armstrong set up Yan Valery to equalise from close range.
Southampton report | Spurs report

Raheem Sterling’s 13-minute hat-trick helped Manchester City beat Watford 3-1 to extend their lead to four points at the top of the Premier League.
Sergio Aguero’s pass was cleared by Daryl Janmaat against Sterling and the ball looped in.
His second came four minutes later, tapping in Riyad Mahrez’s crossand he completed his hat-trick on 59 minutes after being played in by David Silva.
Watford got a consolation when substitutes Troy Deeney and Gerard Deulofeu

Watford substitute Andre Gray scored a stoppage-time winner as Brendan Rodgers's reign at Leicester City began with a defeat.
The Hornets went ahead in only the fifth minute, when a free-kick from Gerard Deulofeu was glanced in by Troy Deeney for his first home goal since September.
Jamie Vardy equalised for Leicester on 75 minutes after he latched on to a pass from Youri Tielemans to finish past Ben Foster.
Watford report | Leicester report

Chelsea kept the pressure on their top-four rivals as first-half goals from Gonzalo Higuain and Jorginho earned a 2-1 victory at Fulham.
Higuain put Chelsea ahead in the 20th minute, converting a low cross from Cesar Azpilicueta.
Kepa Arrizabalaga did well to deny Aleksandar Mitrovic, but from the corner, Calum Chambers volleyed in the equaliser on 27 minutes.
Chelsea restored their lead four minutes later through Jorginho's well-placed strike, his first goal since Matchweek 1.
New Fulham manager Scott Parker saw his team fight back after the break, Arrizabalaga denying Tom Cairney and Joe Bryan before saving a late header from Mitrovic.
Fulham report | Chelsea report

Liverpool had the best chance in the first half but Mohamed Salah was stopped by Jordan Pickford when through on goal.
a last-ditch challenge from Michael Keane denied him.
In similar fashion, Fabinho seemed destined to score from a Virgil van Dijk knockdown, but Lucas Digne intercepted just in time.
Everton came closest when substitute Richarlison's low cross was narrowly missed by Bernard.
Everton report | Liverpool report

Tottenham HotspurHugo Lloris saved an added-time penalty from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang as the hosts came back from a goal down to claim a draw in the north London derby
| Arsenal report

A goal from substitute Riyad Mahrez was enough to earn Manchester City a 1-0 win at AFC Bournemouth and return them to the top of the Premier League.
David Silva and Nicolas Otamendi went closest for City in the first half, before Mahrez struck after coming on for the injured Kevin De Bruyne.
’s side had chances to extend their lead, with Boruc saving from Raheem Sterling, Mahrez and Sergio Aguero, whose chip he turned on to the bar.

Florin Andone came on to earn Brighton & Hove Albion a first Premier League victory of the year, beating Huddersfield Town 1-0. 
In an even first half at the Amex Stadium, Alex Pritchard forced Brighton's Mat Ryan into a save while Alireza Jahanbakhsh hit the bar.
After the break, Philip Billing was denied by Ryan before Jonas Lossl kept out an effort from Andone. 
The Romanian eventually found the back of the net, glancing in Anthony Knockaert's cross 11 minutes from time. 
Brighton report | Huddersfield report

Phil Bardsley put Jeffrey Schlupp's low cross past Tom Heaton and into his own net on 15 minutes to open the scoring. 
Ashley Barnes grabbed a consolation in the 90th minute as Burnley drop to 16th with 30 points. 
Burnley report| Crystal Palace report

Romelu Lukaku scored twice for the second match running as Manchester United came from behind to beat Southampton 3-2 and return to fourth.
Yan Valery gave Southampton a shock first-half lead with a spectacular long shot for his first senior goal.
Southampton hit back through James Ward-Prowse’s 75th-minute free-kick.
But Lukaku struck the winner on 88 minutes and United could have had a fourth but Angus Gunn saved Paul Pogba's stoppage-time penalty.
Southampton report

Two quickfire first-half goals eased Wolverhampton Wanderers past Cardiff City at Molineux.
Diogo Jota struck first with a low finish into the bottom left corner from Raul Jimenez’s pass on 16 minutes.

West Ham United extended their home Premier League unbeaten run to five matches with a 2-0 victory over Newcastle United.
Newcastle posed more of a threat after the break as Ayoze Perez shot wide three minutes after the restart, while Salomon Rondon forced Lukasz Fabianski into action and had a late chance blocked. 
West Ham report | Newcastle report

Mesut Ozil put the Gunners in front after only four minutes, receiving Sead Kolasinac's pass and lifting the ball over Cherries goalkeeper Artur Boruc.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan doubled the lead after combining well with Ozil on 27 minutes, before Dan Gosling teed up Lys Mousset to pull a goal back for AFC Bournemouth three minutes later.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang made it 4-1 on 59 minutes, and substitute Alexandre Lacazette sealed the victory with a superb free-kick with 12 minutes left.
Arsenal report | AFC Bournemouth report

Oriol Romeu opened the scoring on 23 minutes with a shot through a crowded penalty area following a corner kick. 
James Ward-Prowse reacted quickest after Sergio Rico had denied Nathan Redmond to double the advantage five minutes before half-time. 
Fulham's Aleksandar Mitrovic fired over within 30 seconds of half-time before team-mate Ryan Babel hit the crossbar with 16 minutes to play. 
Southampton report| Fulham report

Chelsea bounced back from defeat in the EFL Cup final by beating Tottenham Hotspur 2-0 at Stamford Bridge. 
The Blues started brightly when Gonzalo Higuain hit the post with a swerving shot.
The visitors also hit the woodwork two minutes before the break when Harry Winks's effort crashed off the crossbar. 
Maurizio Sarri's side sealed victory in the 84th minute when Kieran Trippier's errant backpass eluded Lloris and went into the back of his own net.
Chelsea report | Spurs report

Two goals from Romelu Lukaku helped Manchester United claim a 3-1 victory at Crystal Palace to maintain pressure on the Premier League's top four.
Andros Townsend had two early chances for the Eagles, while at the other end Lukaku volleyed over from a corner.
Joel Ward's diving header gave Crystal Palace hope with 24 minutes left, before Ashley Young settled the contest on 83 minutes.
Crystal Palace report |

Mane headed in Trent Alexander-Arnold's cross to open the scoring on nine minutes before producing a brilliant backheeled finish to double the lead 11 minutes later.
Divock Origi fired in to make it 3-0 in the 66th minute before substitute Andre Gray forced Alisson into two saves in three minutes as Watford pushed for a reply.
The first came from Alexander-Arnold's cross for the right-back's third assist of the match, the second from Andy Robertson's centre.
Liverpool report |Watford report

Sergio Aguero scored the only goal from the penalty spot as Manchester City kept the pressure on leaders Liverpool with a 1-0 win over West Ham United.
After the break, West Ham almost went ahead but Ederson saved superbly from Andy Carroll's shot.
Man City broke the deadlock on 59 minutes, Aguero converting from the spot after Bernardo Silva had gone down under pressure from Felipe Anderson.

Gylfi Sigurdsson scored twice and Dominic Calvert-Lewin added a third late on as Everton beat Cardiff City 3-0.
Everton broke the deadlock four minutes before half-time when Seamus Coleman squared the ball to Sigurdsson to drive home.
The Icelander netted again with a well-struck left-footed effort on 66 minutes.
Calvert-Lewin slotted in Idrissa Gueye's pass in stoppage time to seal a Toffees win ahead of the Merseyside derby.
Cardiff report | Everton report

A stoppage-time strike by Steve Mounie snatched Huddersfield Town's third PL win of the season as they triumphed 1-0 against Wolverhampton Wanderers at John Smith's Stadium.
Jonathan Hogg’s early effort for the hosts deflected narrowly wide of Rui Patricio’s goal, before Raul Jimenez went close with a header for Wolves.
Terence Kongolo, Aaron Mooy, Mounie and Hogg all passed up second-half chances for Huddersfield Town, while Ruben Neves, Willy Boly and Jimenez threatened at the other end.
But in the first minute of added time Karlan Grant's effort was saved by Patricio, and Mounie pounced to earn a first victory for his side since they defeated Wolves on 25 November.
Huddersfield Town remain 20th, on 14 points, while Wolves are eighth on 40 points.

Leicester City recorded their first victory in six Premier League matches with a 2-1 home win over Brighton & Hove Albion.
Demarai Gray latched on to Youri Tielemans's pass to slot past Brighton goalkeeper Mat Ryan.
After the break, Glenn Murray might have scored an equaliser but sent his close-range shot wide.
Leicester doubled their lead as Jamie Vardy rifled in his ninth PL goal of the season on 63 minutes.
Leicester report | Brighton report

First-half goals from Fabian Schar and Sean Longstaff earned a 2-0 victory for Newcastle United against Burnley at St James' Park.
After Miguel Almiron shot wide early on, Schar unleashed an unstoppable strike which flew in off a post after 24 minutes.
Seven minutes before half-time, Matt Ritchie's cross was half-cleared byBen Mee and Academy graduate Longstaff lashed in his first Premier League goal.
Salomon Rondon and Almiron both had chances to make the match safe for Newcastle, before a late header by substitute Peter Crouch was hoisted to safety by Jamaal Lascelles.
Newcastle report | Burnley report

The Armenian drifted into the box to sweep home Alex Iwobi's cross for his fifth Premier League goal of the season.
James Ward-Prowse shot narrowly wide of the target shortly after the restart before Matt Targett was denied by Bernd Leno late on as the visitors looked for a route back into the match. 
Arsenal report| Southampton report

Liverpool returned to the top of the Premier League table after a goalless draw with Manchester United at Old Trafford.
Paul Pogba directed a header from Ashley Young's cross straight at the Liverpool goalkeeper six minutes after the restart before Georginio Wijnaldum and Joel Matip passed up chances from consecutive corners on 70 minutes. 
Man Utd report | Liverpool report

Burnley dented Tottenham Hotspur's title hopes as Ashley Barnes' late goal earned a 2-1 victory at Turf Moor.
After a goalless first half dominated by Spurs, but with few chances, Chris Wood gave Burnley the lead 12 minutes after the restart.
The New Zealander headed in Dwight McNeil's corner for his fourth goal in the last four PL matches.
Spurs were level eight minutes later as Harry Kane, back from injury, raced on to Danny Rose's throw-in to slot in for his 15th goal of the season.
Barnes netted the winner seven minutes from time, converting Johann Berg Gudmundsson's ball across the six-yard area to score for the fourth match running.
Burnley report | Spurs report

AFC Bournemouth and Wolverhampton Wanderers drew 1-1 at Vitality Stadium in a match dominated by penalties.
Joshua King gave the Cherries the lead from the spot after 14 minutes for his ninth Premier League goal of the season, having been fouled by Joao Moutinho. 
Jordon Ibe hit the crossbar for the home side with 17 minutes left before Raul Jimenez's 10th PL goal of the season drew Wolves level with a penalty after Matt Doherty had been brought down.
King had the chance to settle the match for a second time from the spot on 85 minutes, after Ryan Fraser had been fouled, but the Norwegian steered his penalty wide. 
AFC Bournemouth report | Wolves report

Goals from Salomon Rondon and Ayoze Perez earned Newcastle United a 2-0 win over 10-man Huddersfield Town.
Newcastle almost opened the scoring in the 12th minute at St James' Park, but Miguel Almiron, on his full debut, and Rondon each struck the post.
DeAndre Yedlin played in Isaac Hayden, who diverted the ball into the path of Rondon to finish.
Huddersfield remain bottom with 11 points.
Newcastle report

Michy Batshuayi scored his first Crystal Palace goal and Wilfried Zaha netted twice as the Eagles won 4-1 at Leicester City.
On a day in which Palace's Roy Hodgson became the oldest manager in Premier League history, it was Leicester who started strongly, with Jamie Vardy's header going narrowly over.
But Palace made the breakthrough in the 40th minute when Batshuayi diverted James McArthur's wayward shot into the net.
On 64 minutes, Leicester were level when Jonny Evans fired in Harvey Barnes' low ball into the box.
Leicester report |

Gerard Deulofeu scored a hat-trick and Troy Deeney netted twice as Watford emphatically defeated Cardiff City 5-1.
After Ben Foster had made a brilliant double save to deny Oumar Niasse, Deulofeu put Watford ahead on 18 minutes, finishing from a Deeney pass.
Deulofeu completed his treble two minutes later, when he was played in by Etienne Capoue and chipped Etheridge.
Deeney had his first in the 73rd minute, while Cardiff pulled one back through Sol Bamba.
Cardiff report | Watford report

West Ham United came from a goal down to beat Fulham 3-1 at London Stadium.
Ryan Babel put Fulham ahead in only the third minute.A low ball into the box from Ryan Sessegnon found the Dutchman and he fired in from eight yards.
West Ham were level through Chicharito on 29 minutes when he turned in a flick from Issa Diop at the back post.
In stoppage time, Michail Antonio made sure of the victory with a powerful header to move West Ham up to ninth on 36 points.
West Ham report | Fulham report

Wolverhampton Wanderers struck late again to rescue a 1-1 draw at home to Newcastle United.
Willy Boly rose above Newcastle goalkeeper Martin Dubravka in the fifth minute of stoppage time to nod in Adama Traore's cross, Wolves' fifth goal from the 90th minute this season.
Ruben Neves and Raul Jimenez had chances for Wolves in the first half with Newcastle soaking up pressure, before Salomon Rondon shot wide for the visitors.
Newcastle took the lead 11 minutes after the break when Fabian Schar slid a pass to Isaac Hayden, who shot past Rui Patricio at his near post.

Tottenham Hotspur maintained pressure on the Premier League's top two with a 3-1 win against Leicester City at Wembley Stadium.
Leicester might also have levelled on 58 minutes after Jan Vertonghen fouled James Maddison in the area and Jamie Vardy came off the bench to take the spot-kick, but Hugo Lloris saved his penalty.
Eriksen's sweet shot found the bottom corner three minutes later, and after Lloris made another fine save from Barnes, Vardy gave the Foxes hope when turning in Ricardo Pereira's cross with 14 minutes left.
But Son Heung-min burst away to settle matters in stoppage time.

Sergio Aguero scored another hat-trick as Manchester City emphatically defeated Chelsea 6-0 at the Etihad Stadium to return to the top of the Premier League table.
Raheem Sterling fired into the roof of the net after only four minutes before Aguero hit a quickfire double, curling a superb 13th-minute shot into the top corner and then poaching his second and City’sIlkay Gundogan made the score 4-0 after 25 minutes, while Aguero's penalty 11 minutes after half-time put him level with Alan Shearer's PL record of 11 hat-tricks.
Sterling added a sixth 10 minutes from time after a slick move down the left.
City are top on goal difference, level with Liverpool on 60 points having played one match more.Chelsea drop to sixth on 50 points, behind Arsenal on goal scored.
Man City report | Chelsea report

Paul Pogba scored twice as Manchester United climbed into the top four for the first time since the opening day of the season with a 3-0 victory at Fulham.
Fulham's Luciano Vietto fired wide from close range in the first minute as the hosts started brightly.
Pogba’s penalty sealed the win with 25 minutes left after Maxime Le Marchand brought down Juan Mata.
Fulham report |

Wilfried Zaha's second-half goal rescued a point for Crystal Palace in a 1-1 draw with West Ham United.
Ryan Fredericks and Chicharito had early chances for the Hammers, who took the lead from the spot after Palace goalkeeper Vicente Guaita clattered into Michail Antonio and Mark Noble stepped up to convert the spot-kick.
James McArthur missed a golden opportunity to level when put through, but shot wide with the goal gaping.
Crystal Palace report | West Ham report

Arsenal earned a first away win in the Premier League since November, beating Huddersfield Town 2-1 at John Smith's Stadium. 
Alex Iwobi's 16th-minute deflected volley gave Arsenal the lead before Henrikh Mkhitaryan was denied by Ben Hamer.
Huddersfield Town's Adama Diakhaby forced a smart save from Bernd Leno shortly after the break before curling another effort wide.
The home side did claim just a sixth home goal this season when Karlan Grant scored from close range in the third minute of stoppage time.
Huddersfield report | Arsenal report

Georginio Wijnaldum's superb lob helped Liverpool beat AFC Bournemouth 3-0 at Anfield and return to the top of the Premier League table.
Sadio Mane opened the scoring in the 24th minute, heading in James Milner's right-wing cross.
Liverpool doubled their advantage 10 minutes later from Wijnaldum's pinpoint lob after Andrew Robertson had played him through.
Three minutes after the break, Roberto Firmino's flick set up Mohamed Salah to make it 3-0 for his first goal in three matches and his league-leading 17th of the season.
Liverpool report | AFC Bournemouth report

Kenneth Zohore's stoppage-time winner earned Cardiff City a dramatic 2-1 victory at Southampton that moved them out of the relegation zone.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg and Nathan Redmond had chances for the hosts while Aron Gunnarsson shot over at the other end in a goalless first half.
Southampton levelled when Jack Stephens turned inCharlie Austin's flick at the far post from a corner in the first minute of added time.
Southampton report | Cardiff report

Andre Gray scored the only goal of the match as Watford beat Everton at Vicarage Road. 
Both teams came close in the first half, with Watford's Etienne Capoue and Everton's Kurt Zouma forcing smart saves from Jordan Pickford and Ben Foster respectively. 
Substitute Gray broke the deadlock with 25 minutes to play, converting Will Hughes' low cross inside the six-yard box. 
Everton's Lucas Digne's left-footed free-kick cannoned off the crossbar late on.See: Watford report | Everton report

Burnley extended their unbeaten run to seven matches with a 3-1 victory at Brighton & Hove Albion.
Burnley took the lead two minutes later, Chris Wood latching on to Ashley Barnes' through-ball to slot past Mat Ryan.  
but Shane Duffy's header was cleared off the line by Jeff Hendrick. 
Wood scored his second just after the hour before Ashley Barnes made it 3-0 from the penalty spot. 
Brighton report | Burnley report

Stoppage-time goals at the end of each half gave Manchester City a 2-0 win against Everton at Goodison Park that sent them top of the Premier League.
Sergio Aguero hit the crossbar early on and Aymeric Laporte sent a header just wide as the visitors probed for the breakthrough that came on the stroke of half-time.
Laporte climbed highest to head David Silva’s free-kick into the top corner.
Aguero, Silva and substitute Raheem Sterling all threatened after the break but the match was settled in the dying moments.
Substitute Gabriel Jesus was put through by Kevin De Bruyne and scored at the second attempt after his first effort had been blocked by Jordan Pickford.
Everton report | Man City report

Chicharito and Aaron Cresswell both went close for the hosts before Liverpool took a 22nd-minute lead, Sadio Mane finishing coolly after good work by Adam Lallana and James Milner.
West Ham pegged the visitors back six minutes later as a clever free-kick routine released Antonio to fire an angled shot in off the far post.
Declan Rice headed over before half-time, while fellow West Ham midfielder Mark Noble narrowly cleared the bar on 73 minutes.
Liverpool substitute Divock Origi then fired straight at Lukasz Fabianski with the last kick of the match.
West Ham report | Liverpool report

An early goal from Marcus Rashford earned Manchester United a hard-fought 1-0 win at Leicester City to keep up their battle for fourth.
After missing an easy header in the fifth minute Rashford made amends, neatly controlling and finishing Paul Pogba’s chip over the top four minutes later.
Leicester recovered, with James Maddison denied by a block when he looked set to score.
David De Gea was forced into action from Jamie Vardy’s overhead kick and Rachid Gezzal’s free-kick, before Vardy shot straight at the goalkeeper in the dying minutes.

Sergio Aguero’s hat-trick earned Manchester City a 3-1 home victory over Arsenal to take them to within two points of the Premier League summit.
Lucas Torreira’s corner for Laurent Koscielny to head in from close range.
Ilkay Gundogan picked out Raheem Sterling with a lofted pass and Aguero dispatched the winger’s first-time pass.
Man City report | Arsenal report

Son Heung-min scored a late winner as Tottenham Hotspur moved into second place with a 1-0 win over Newcastle United.
Spurs started impressively and Lucas Moura put an Erik Lamela cross wide before the latter then headed against the crossbar.
At the other end, Christian Eriksen's clever flick beat Dubravka but Fabian Schar cleared, while Hugo Lloris produced a fine save to deny Ayoze Perez before Son struck.
| Newcastle report

Ben Foster produced an impressive goalkeeping display to earn Watford a 0-0 draw at Brighton & Hove Albion.There were few chances in the first half, but Jurgen Locadia came closest as his back-post header was clawed out of the top corner by Foster.
Watford winger Ken Sema headed over the away side's best chance from close range under pressure from Brighton's defence shortly after the restart.
Foster's heroics continued in the 80th minute, tipping over another Locadia header before clearing a Shane Duffy overhead kick off the line with his feet from the next corner.
The Watford goalkeeper was needed again in the 86th minute, saving from Florin Andone when the Brighton striker broke into the area.
Brighton report |Watford report

Ashley Barnes scored a last-gasp penalty as Burnley earned a 1-1 draw against Southampton at Turf Moor.
The striker drilled in the Clarets' first Premier League spot-kick since April 2017 after Jack Stephens handled the ball under pressure from Burnley debutant substitute Peter Crouch.
Southampton started brightly and Danny Ings was denied by Tom Heaton when through on goal, before going off with an injury.
Nathan Redmond put Saints 1-0 up with a superb 55th-minute strike. 
Barnes was denied by McCarthy from close range then hit the crossbar before his dramatic equaliser, which keeps both sides unbeaten in the PL in 2019.
Southampton are 16th, ahead of Burnley on goal difference only and two points above the relegation zone.
Burnley report | Southampton report

Gonzalo Higuain scored his first goals for Chelsea to help them return to winning ways with a 5-0 win over Huddersfield Town.
Looking to recover from back-to-back defeats, Chelsea took the lead at Stamford Bridge on 16 minutes when a reverse pass from N'Golo Kante found Higuain, who fired in at the near post.
Eden Hazard doubled it with a penalty just before the break, after Cesar Azpilicueta had been fouled.
The Belgian made it 3-0 on 66 minutes, finishing from Ross Barkley's through-ball, before Higuain struck his second, curling in via a deflection.
David Luiz headed in a Willian corner late on as Chelsea returned to fourth on 50 points, three ahead of Arsenal, who play Manchester City on Sunday.
Chelsea report | Huddersfield report

Fulham started well and could have led but Aleksandar Mitrovic headed a Joe Bryan cross wide from six yards.
Michy Batshuayi, on for his debut, saw his shot saved by Sergio Rico but only into the path of Schlupp to finish.
Fulham are 19th with 17 points.
Crystal Palace report | Fulham report

Wolverhampton Wanderers won their third consecutive Premier League match with a 3-1 victory at Everton.
But on the stroke of half-time, Raul Jimenez headed in their second from a Joao Moutinho free-kick to restore Wolves' lead.
Leander Dendoncker made sure of the points with a close-range volley in the 66th minute.
Everton report |

Bobby Reid marked his 26th birthday with two goals as Cardiff City earned an emotional 2-0 home victory over AFC Bournemouth.
After the Cardiff City Stadium had paid tribute to missing Cardiff striker Emiliano Sala, Cherries goalkeeper Artur Boruc soon had to deny Oumar Niasse.
In the fifth minute, Reid put Cardiff ahead from the penalty spot, after Steve Cook handled Josh Murphy's cross.
Aron Gunnarsson played in Reid, who rounded Boruc to tap in.
Nathan Ake headed a late chance wide for AFC Bournemouth, who remain 10th on 33 points.
Cardiff report | AFC Bournemouth report

Joshua King scored twice as AFC Bournemouth earned a 4-0 victory over Chelsea at Vitality Stadium.
The Blues might have taken the lead when Mateo Kovacic's header was acrobatically pushed on to the crossbar by Artur Boruc.
But the home side opened the scoring two minutes after the break when David Brooks played in King to finish with a first-time shot.
: AFC Bournemouth report | Chelsea report

James Ward-Prowse scored for the third Premier League match in a row to earn a 1-1 draw for Southampton against 10-man Crystal Palace.
Ward-Prowse met Matt Targett's left-wing cross and finished into the bottom corner in the 77th minute.
Wilfried Zaha had given Palace the lead from the edge of the area four minutes before half-time with his fourth goal of the season – all of them coming away from home.
Southampton report | Crystal Palace report

Liverpool missed the chance to open up a seven-point lead over Manchester City at the top of the Premier League as they were held to a 1-1 draw by Leicester City.
They looked on course for an eighth successive home league win when Sadio Mane put them ahead in the third minute.
James Maddison missed a presentable chance to equalise before Harry Maguire put them level in the second minute of first-half stoppage time.
Maddison came close again after the break before Kasper Schmeichel denied Liverpool's Roberto Firmino at the other end.
Liverpool report | Leicester report

Tottenham Hotspur scored twice in the last 10 minutes to come back from a goal down and beat Watford 2-1 at Wembley Stadium.
Fernando Llorente's trickery in the box found Son Heung-min, who celebrated his return to the starting line-up with his ninth PL goal of the season. 
Mauricio Pochettino's side completed their comeback three minutes from time when Llorente headed in Danny Rose's cross. 
| Watford report

Goals from Pierre Emerick-Aubameyang and Alexandre Lacazette earned Arsenal a 2-1 victory over Cardiff City.
After paying tribute to Cardiff striker Emiliano Sala before kick-off, the Bluebirds started impressively, with Bobby Reid hitting the side-netting.
But in the 66th minute, Aubameyang put Arsenal ahead when he converted a penalty after Sead Kolasinac had been fouled by Bruno Ecuele Manga.
Arsenal doubled their lead through Lacazette's drilled effort after a driving run, before Nathaniel Mendez-Laing curled in a stoppage-time consolation goal for Cardiff.
Arsenal have moved level on 47 points with fourth-placed Chelsea but remain fifth on goal difference.
Arsenal report | Cardiff report

Aleksandar Mitrovic struck twice as Fulham fought back from 2-0 down to beat Brighton & Hove Albion 4-2 at Craven Cottage.
Glenn Murray gave the visitors a third-minute lead with a volley before doubling their advantage 14 minutes later after linking up with Pascal Gross. 
Calum Chambers pulled a goal back with a superb volley into the top-left corner on 47 minutes, before Mitrovic headed Fulham level just before the hour mark. 
Luciano Vietto headed Ryan Babel's wayward shot into the net to complete the scoring 11 minutes from time. 
Fulham report |Brighton report

Richarlison's early goal gave Everton a 1-0 victory as Jan Siewert suffered defeat in his match as Huddersfield Town manager.
Everton substitute Lucas Digne was then shown a red card for denying Adama Diakhaby a goalscoring opportunity with 24 minutes to play. 
Aaron Mooy came close from the resulting free-kick but was denied by Jordan Pickford, who produced another fine save to deny Elias Kachunga an equalising goal on 79 minutes. 
Huddersfield report | Everton report

Raul Jimenez scored two late goals as Wolverhampton Wanderers beat West Ham United 3-0 to move up to seventh in the Premier League table.
The home side had the upper hand throughout but did not break the deadlock until the 66th minute, when Romain Saiss headed in from Joao Moutinho's corner.
Jimenez made the match safe when he lifted the ball over Lukasz Fabianski after being put through by Diogo Jota on 86 minutes.
West Ham, who failed to have a shot on target, drop to 11th in the table with 31 points, four points below Wolves. 
Wolves report | West Ham report

Burnley ended Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's winning start at Manchester United as a late comeback from the Red Devils earned a 2-2 draw.
After a first half of few chances, Burnley took the lead after 51 minutes when Ashley Barnes fired in from Jack Cork's pass. 
Chris Wood doubled their advantage when he headed in Ashley Westwood's 81st-minute cross.
But Paul Pogba pulled a goal back for Man Utd with an 87th-minute penalty, after a foul on Jesse Lingard.
In stoppage time, Victor Lindelof equalised with his first goal for the club after Alexis Sanchez's effort had been saved. 
Man Utd report | Burnley report

Matt Ritchie clinched a comeback 2-1 victory for Newcastle United as champions Manchester City missed out on the chance to close in on Premier League leaders Liverpool. 
Man City took the lead in the first minute when Sergio Aguero scored from David Silva's headed pass.

Manchester City kept up the pressure on Premier League leaders Liverpool with a 3-0 victory over Huddersfield Town.
Sane turned from provider to scorer, calmly passing into the net after a clever cushioned header by Sergio Aguero.
Steve Mounie three times threatened to score for the home side, the best chance being right at the end, but shot wide as Huddersfield Town stay bottom on 11 points.
Huddersfield Town report |

A last-gasp header from Harry Winks gave Tottenham Hotspur a dramatic victory over Fulham at Craven Cottage.
Fulham took the lead when Spurs striker Fernando Llorente, starting in place of the injured Harry Kane, turned the ball into his own net from a corner on 17 minutes.
Fulham report | Spurs report

Diogo Jota struck deep into stoppage time to complete his hat-trick and snatch victory for Wolverhampton Wanderers against Leicester City in a pulsating seven-goal thriller at Molineux.
Jota netted the opener from Joao Moutinho's cross after four minutes, and eight minutes later it was 2-0 when Ryan Bennett headed in after out-jumping Harry Maguire.
Two minutes after half-time Demarai Gray raced clear to tuck a fine finish beyond Patricio, and Harvey Barnes's shot, on his first Premier League start, was deflected in by Conor Coady on 51 minutes.
Neves set Jota free to make it 3-2, before a towering header by Morgan levelled the match with three minutes left.
Wolves report | Leicester report

A wonder goal from Callum Wilson helped AFC Bournemouth get back to winning ways and beat West Ham United 2-0 at Vitality Stadium.
Earlier, David Brooks and Jefferson Lerma went close for the Cherries.For West Ham, Samir Nasri's shot hit a post midway through the first half and Andy Carroll fired over from two yards out.
AFC Bournemouth report | West Ham report

Mohamed Salah scored twice as leaders Liverpool fought back from a goal down to beat Crystal Palace 4-3 at Anfield.
But Salah’s smart finish levelled the match a minute after half-time, before Roberto Firmino linked with Naby Keita to score Liverpool's second on 53 minutes.
Liverpool's James Milner was sent off in the 89th minute for two bookable offences before Sadio Mane scored a fourth in added time and Max Meyer produced a late consolation for the visitors.
Crystal Palace stay 14th on 22.
Liverpool report |

Paul Pogba and Marcus Rashford continued their magnificent recent form with a goal each as Manchester United beat Brighton & Hove Albion 2-1.
Rashford made it 2-0 with a brilliant piece of skill and a finish into the top-right corner from an acute angle three minutes before half-time.
Pascal Gross pulled a goal back in the 73rd minute when he fired in off the crossbar, following Davy Propper's cross.

Fabian Schar scored his first two Premier League goals as Newcastle United beat Cardiff City 3-0 at St James' Park.
He made it 2-0 in the 63rd minute with a close-range finish after Matt Ritchie's corner was flicked on by Jamaal Lascelles.
Newcastle report | Cardiff report

James Ward-Prowse was on target as Southampton earned a 2-1 win over Everton at St Mary's Stadium.
Southampton had dominated early possession and twice hit the woodwork in the first half, through Nathan Redmond and a deflected Danny Ings effort.
Everton pulled a goal back in added time when Gylfi Sigurdsson found the bottom corner.
Southampton report | Everton report

Chris Wood had a goal disallowed in added time as Burnley and Watford shared a goalless draw at Vicarage Road.
The hosts almost went ahead in the fourth minute when Ken Sema had a shot cleared off the line by James Tarkowski.
Burnley might have taken the lead five minutes before the break, but Ashley Barnes blasted his effort wide when well placed to score.
With the match nearly over, Dwight McNeil had his shot saved and Wood put the ball into the net, only for the goal to be ruled out for offside.
Watford report | Burnley report

Laurent Koscielny scored his first goal since his return from injury as Arsenal boosted their top-four hopes with a 2-0 win over Chelsea at Emirates Stadium.
Arsenal took a deserved lead on 14 minutes when Hector Bellerin's cross was controlled by Alexandre Lacazette, who superbly found room to fire into the roof of the net from an acute angle.
Marcos Alonso hit the post for Chelsea shortly before half-time, while Koscielny did well to block a fierce shot from substitute Ross Barkley.
Arsenal report | Chelsea report

Manchester City closed the gap on leaders Liverpool as Gabriel Jesus inspired them to a 3-0 victory over 10-man Wolverhampton Wanderers.
Man City took the lead after only 10 minutes, with Jesus tapping in Leroy Sane's cross from six yards out.Nine minutes later Wolves were reduced to 10 men when Willy Boly was dismissed for a dangerous challenge on Bernardo Silva.
Jesus added a second goal six minutes before half-time, finding the net with a penalty after Raheem Sterling had been brought down by Ryan Bennett.
City dominated play in the second half and victory was sealed with 12 minutes to go, when substitute Kevin De Bruyne's cross was diverted into his own net by Wolves defender Conor Coady.

After the break, Nathan Ake cleared a Richarlison shot off the line, while Steve Cook went close with a header at the other end.
On 61 minutes Lucas Digne burst down Everton’s left and crossed in for Zouma to head in the opening goal, before Calvert-Lewin struck in stoppage time following good work from Ademola Lookman.
Everton report | AFC Bournemouth report

Marcus Rashford scored and David De Gea made 11 saves in an outstanding display as Manchester United earned a 1-0 win at Tottenham Hotspur and continued their perfect winning run under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.
Rashford superbly finished beyond Hugo Lloris in the 44th minute, after being played in by a wonderful Paul Pogba pass.
Four minutes after the break, Kane's shot brought a sharp save from De Gea, who was outstanding in the second half as he denied the England striker, Dele Alli and Christian Eriksen.

Declan Rice's first goal for West Ham United earned their first home victory in the Premier League over Arsenal since 2006.
West Ham goalkeeper Lukasz Fabianski early on, but the Hammers soon took control with Samir Nasri pulling a shot wide.
Anderson's cross was half-cleared and Nasri teed up Rice to curl into the top corner.
Alex Iwobi and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang both went close to equalising but the Hammers held firm.
West Ham report | Arsenal report

Mohamed Salah’s second-half penalty stretched Liverpool's Premier League lead to seven points with a 1-0 win over Brighton & Hove Albion.
Liverpool dominated early possession and Xherdan Shaqiri glanced a header just wide in a first half of few chances. 
Gross had a chance to redeem himself but his shot was blocked by Fabinho, playing as a centre-back.

Jeff Hendrick's second strike of the season and a Denis Odoi own goal helped Burnley to a third successive Premier League victory as they beat Fulham 2-1. 
, Luciano Vietto being denied by a James Tarkowski goalline clearance before the striker shot narrowly wide.

Huddersfield Town ended their eight-match losing run but were unable to claim a much-needed win as they drew 0-0 with Cardiff City.

Craig Cathcart scored at both ends as Watford came from behind to beat Crystal Palace 2-1.
Roy Hodgson's side took the lead against the run of play in the 38th minute when Cathcart turned the ball into the back of his own net following a goalmouth scramble.
The visitors equalised midway through the second half, Cathcart making amends by levelling with a header from Jose Holebas's corner.

Pedro opened the scoring on nine minutes, latching on to a long David Luiz pass before lobbing Martin Dubravka.

Pedro was denied a second goal two minutes after the restart before Willian restored Chelsea's lead with a curling effort from the edge of the penalty area.

Leroy Sane scored the winning goal as Manchester City handed Liverpool a first Premier League defeat of the season with a 2-1 win at Etihad Stadium to close the gap on the leaders.

Sane restored City's advantage in the 72nd minute, firing in via the far post after racing on to Raheem Sterling's pass.

Troy Deeney scored twice as Watford earned a thrilling 3-3 draw at AFC Bournemouth.

The home side dominated possession and came closest to a first-half goal when Eden Hazard struck a powerful left-footed shot, which was saved by the face of Gunn, in for Alex McCarthy.

Ashley Barnes scored the winner as Burnley beat Huddersfield Town 2-1 to move out of the relegation zone.
Steve Mounie’s fine header from Isaac MbenzaThe lead lasted just seven minutes as Chris Wood equalised from close range after good work by Dwight McNeil.
Just a minute later, Huddersfield's Christopher Schindler was sent off for a second booking.
After half-time Johann Berg Gudmundsson went close for Burnley before Ashley Westwood teed up Barnes to score with 16 minutes left.
Robbie Brady's late red card meant both teams finished with 10 men.

Marko Arnautovic scored a quickfire double to earn a 2-2 comeback draw for West Ham United at home to Brighton & Hove Albion.
During a goalless first half, Arnautovic and Felipe Anderson both forced smart saves from David Button in the visitors’ goal.
Two minutes later it was 2-0 after Shane Duffy’s excellent volley from close range.
Arnautovic pounced twice in quick succession on 66 and 68 minutes to level the match, first poking the ball in after Mark Noble's ball over the top, and then converting a Michail Antonio cutback.

Two late goals earned Crystal Palace a 2-0 victory against Wolverhampton Wanderers at Molineux.
Wolves failed to have a shot on target and were punished by Jordan Ayew in the 83rd minute. 
The striker controlled Patrick van Aanholt's wayward shot and slotted it into the net from five yards for his first goal for the club.
Palace secured the win with a stoppage-time penalty, dispatched by Milivojevic after Ryan Bennett had fouled Wilfried Zaha. 
Wolves report | Palace report

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer continued his perfect start as caretaker manager as Manchester United beat Newcastle United 2-0 to move within six points of the top four.
Christian Atsu troubled the Man Utd defence three times during the first half as the home side pushed for a goal. 
The visitors doubled their lead when another substitute Alexis Sanchez played in Rashford, who neatly slotted through Dubravka's legs.
Newcastle are 15th with 18 points.

Jamie Vardy scored the first goal of 2019 as Leicester City beat Everton 1-0 at Goodison Park.
Everton came closest to a first-half goal when Lucas Digne's cross was met by Jonjoe Kenny, whose shot hit the bar.
Pouncing on a miscontrol from Michael Keane, Ricardo Pereira slipped in Vardy to finish past Jordan Pickford for his seventh goal of the season.
Everton struggled to fashion chances to equalise, with Cenk Tosun's shot straight at Kasper Schmeichel one of only two for them on target.
(H)Leicester:

After Ryan Sessegnon had missed two good chances to put Fulham ahead, Arsenal led through Granit Xhaka, who converted Alex Iwobi's cross.
Ten minutes after the break Sead Kolasinac crossed to Alexandre Lacazette, who fired in to make it 2-0.
But another substitute, Aaron Ramsey, restored Arsenal's two-goal lead before Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang sealed victory with a deflected strike, his 14th PL goal of the season.
Arsenal report | Fulham report

Tottenham Hotspur moved to second in the Premier League table with a 3-0 victory at Cardiff City.
Harry Kane opened the scoring when Sean Morrison's attempted clearance fortuitously went in off the striker's knee in the third minute.
Nine minutes later, Christian Eriksen collected Son Heung-min's centre and found the bottom-left corner of the net. 
Cardiff's best chance of the match fell to Junior Hoilett, but he could only direct his header straight at Hugo Lloris.

A second-half goal from N'Golo Kante was enough to give Chelsea a hard-fought 1-0 win at Crystal Palace.
On 51 minutes, Chelsea made the breakthrough.A clever flick from Eden Hazard found Willian but he was denied by Guaita who reacted well to save his low shot.
Olivier Giroud had a goal ruled out for offside for the second time in the match and then had to be substituted after injuring his ankle.
Crystal Palace report | Chelsea report

Goals from Chris Wood and Dwight McNeil gave Burnley a crucial 2-0 win over West Ham United.
Wood put Burnley ahead on the quarter-hour mark when he controlled a header from Ashley Barnes before firing in at the near post.
The 19-year-old arrived late in the area to finish well from an Ashley Westwood cross.
After the break, Burnley twice came close through Barnes and McNeil but both were denied by Lukasz Fabianski.
The Hammers substitute Andy Carrolltested Tom Heaton, making his first appearance for Burnley in 476 days, with a long-range effort.
Burnley report

Manchester City regained ground in the title race with a 3-1 victory over Southampton at St Mary's Stadium. 
David Silva converted Bernardo Silva's pull-back to give City the lead on 10 minutes. 
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg drew Southampton level eight minutes before the break, tackling Oleksandr Zinchenko and firing past Ederson. 
A James Ward-Prowse own goal restored City's advantage before Sergio Aguero headed Zinchenko's cross past Alex McCarthy in first-half stoppage time. 
City pressed for a fourth goal, but both Raheem Sterling and Gabriel Jesus were thwarted by the in-form McCarthy before Hojbjerg received a straight red card with five minutes remaining.

Paul Pogba scored twice as Manchester United beat AFC Bournemouth 4-1 for their third successive Premier League victory. 
Pogba converted a Marcus Rashford cross five minutes in before powering a header past Asmir Begovic on 33 minutes, his fourth goal in three matches under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.
Substitute Romelu Lukaku added the fourth with 18 minutes to play before Pogba was denied his hat-trick by the fingertips of Begovic and a post.
United played the last 11 minutes with 10 men after Eric Bailly was shown a straight red card for a foul on Ryan Fraser.
Manchester United report | AFC Bournemouth report

Jurgen Locadia scored the only goal as Brighton & Hove Albion beat Everton 1-0.
After an even first half, Jordan Pickford produced a superb reflex save to prevent Florin Andone's close-range header from hitting the back of the net.
Everton responded as Richarlison's effort ricocheted off the post and wide, but Brighton held on for the three points.
Everton report

Aleksandar Mitrovic's stoppage-time winner gave Fulham a 1-0 win over Huddersfield Town.
Fulham were given the chance to take the lead with eight minutes left when the referee pointed to the spot after Chris Lowe had handled.
However, Aboubakar Kamara's penalty was saved by Jonas Lossl. 
Nonetheless the hosts produced a last-gasp winner when Mitrovic latched on to Ryan Sessegnon's pass to fire home.

Victor Camarasa scored a superb stoppage-time goal as Cardiff City beat Leicester City 1-0 for their first away victory of the Premier League season.

Late goals from Raul Jimenez and Helder Costa earned Wolverhampton Wanderers a 3-1 comeback win at title-chasing Tottenham Hotspur.
But Willy Bolly headed in from Joao Moutinho's 72nd-minute corner before Wolves clinched victory.

Abdoulaye Doucoure's late equaliser gave Watford a 1-1 draw at home to Newcastle United. 
Salomon Rondon had put Newcastle in front on 29 minutes, heading in Matt Ritchie's cross.
Watford twice came close to drawing level before half-time, but Isaac Success was unable to find a way past Martin Dubravka on both occasions.
The Hornets eventually broke through with eight minutes remaining, substitute Doucoure rising to head Gerard Deulofeu's cross into the net. 
See: Watford report | Newcastle report

Roberto Firmino's hat-trick helped Liverpool defeat Arsenal 5-1 and go nine points clear at the top of the Premier League table.
Ainsley Maitland-Niles had given Arsenal the lead with his first PL goal on 11 minutes, but shortly afterwards Firmino turned the match on its head with two goals in as many minutes. 
Sadio Mane extended Liverpool's lead on 32 minutes before Mohamed Salah drew a foul from Sokratis and scored the resulting penalty in first-half stoppage time.

Two superb Felipe Anderson goals helped West Ham United come from behind to beat Southampton 2-1 at St Mary's Stadium.

struck from close range at the back post.

Burnley report | Everton report

Crystal Palace were denied by the woodwork and great Cardiff City defending as the two teams played out a goalless draw.
Andros Townsend hit the bar for Palace after just two minutes at Selhurst Park, the first of 31 shots the home team had.

Liverpool extended their lead at the top of the table to six points with a 4-0 win over Newcastle United.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer made it two wins from two as Manchester United's caretaker manager, with Paul Pogba scoring twice in a 3-1 win over Huddersfield Town.

Jurgen Locadia made him rue that opportunity, rounding off a swift counter-attack to draw Brighton level five minutes later.

Eden Hazard scored both goals as Chelsea regained fourth spot from Arsenal with a 2-1 win over Watford at Vicarage Road.

then Townsend hit a stunning left-foot volley from outside the penalty area.

Liverpool will top the Premier League at Christmas after an impressive 2-0 victory against Wolverhampton Wanderers at Molineux.
After an end-to-end start, Liverpool went ahead through Mohamed Salah's league-leading 11th Premier League goal of the season, the Egyptian cleverly flicking in Fabinho's cutback first-time.
Jonny and Matt Doherty brought smart saves from Liverpool goalkeeper Alisson before half-time as the hosts toiled to get back on terms.
But Liverpool sealed victory on 68 minutes through Virgil van Dijk's first Premier League goal for the club, a volley from Salah's cross.

Chelsea kept in touch with their top-four rivals as Pedro and Eden Hazard gave them a 2-1 victory at Brighton & Hove Albion.

Matt Targett's curling cross enabled Danny Ings to head home the opener after 18 minutes but 10 minutes later, Henrikh Mkhitaryan guided in a Nacho Monreal centre.

Substitute Alexandre Lacazette's backheel teed up Mkhitaryan to fire in a deflected shot off Jannik Vestergaard on 53 minutes.

Liverpool returned to the top of the Premier League as a late double from substitute Xherdan Shaqiri sealed a 3-1 triumph over Manchester United.

Christian Eriksen struck his first Premier League goal of the season in stoppage time to secure Tottenham Hotspur a 1-0 win against Burnley.
Burnley threatened when Ashley Barnes's second-half volley was blocked by Harry Kane, before Hart saved Lamela's close-range shot late on at the other end.
It looked as if Spurs would draw their first PL match of the season when Son Heung-min drove wide and Dele Alli missed from a metre as the clock ticked down.

Watford scored three brilliant goals before surviving a late Cardiff City comeback to win 3-2 at Vicarage Road. 
Gerard Deulofeu opened the scoring for the hosts on 16 minutes, weaving through the Cardiff defence before slotting the ball past Neil Etheridge. 
A long-range strike from Jose Holebas doubled their advantage shortly after half-time before Domingos Quina superbly curled in his first Premier League goal with 22 minutes remaining. 
Junior Hoilett pulled one back for the visitors with a curling shot from 25 yards in the 80th minute, before Bobby Reid made it 3-2 from close range two minutes later. 
See: Watford report | Cardiff report

An early strike by Raul Jimenez and a late second from Ivan Cavaleiro sealed a 2-0 victory for Wolverhampton Wanderers over AFC Bournemouth at Molineux.
Jimenez slotted in the opener after Diogo Jota's shot deflected into his path on 12 minutes.
After the break, Junior Stanislas hit the bar with a free-kick for AFC Bournemouth, who lost Tyrone Mings through injury.
Four minutes into stoppage time, Cavaleiro played a one-two with Helder Costa before sealing Wolves' first three-match winning run in the Premier League. 
Wolves report | AFC Bournemouth report

Shortly after Lukasz Fabianski had denied Aboubakar Kamara when through on goal, Robert Snodgrass put West Ham ahead on 17 minutes.
In a second half of few chances, Anderson came closest to scoring when his shot was saved by Rico.
Fulham remain bottom on nine. 
Fulham report | West Ham report

Lucas Digne’s stoppage-time free-kick earned Everton a dramatic 2-2 draw against Watford at Goodison Park.
The Hornets levelled in the 63rd minute after Roberto Pereyra’s stinging shot hit the post but rebounded back into the net off Seamus Coleman.
Abdoulaye Doucoure heading in Pereyra’s cross.
Everton might have equalised when a penalty was awarded for a foul on Yerry Mina by Christian Kabasele, but Ben Foster saved Gylfi Sigurdsson’s penalty.
Everton report | Watford report

Matt Doherty scored a dramatic winner as Wolverhampton Wanderers battled to a 2-1 victory at 10-man Newcastle United.
Jota opened the scoring on 17 minutes with his second goal in as many Premier League matches when he controlled and finished Helder Costa's cross.
But, after Salomon Rondon's free-kick crashed off the underside of the crossbar, the Venezuelan picked up the Wolves clearance and crossed for Ayoze Perez to head in Newcastle's 23rd-minute equaliser.
Following Yedlin's dismissal, Wolves substitute Raul Jimenez hit the crossbar with a powerful shot and Doherty had a shot brilliantly saved by Dubravka before he did find the net after Jota's effort was palmed into his path. 
Newcastle report |

A Mohamed Salah hat-trick sent Liverpool top of the Premier League with an assured 4-0 victory at AFC Bournemouth.
Liverpool went ahead on 25 minutes at Vitality Stadium after Asmir Begovic parried Roberto Firmino’s fierce shot and Salah netted the rebound.
After 68 minutes another incisive Liverpool move ended with Cook turning Andrew Robertson’s cross into the net to make it 3-0.
: AFC Bournemouth report | Liverpool report

A late overhead kick by Lucas Torreira earned Arsenal a 1-0 victory against a resolute Huddersfield Town at Emirates Stadium.
Seven players were booked in the first half, as Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang and Alexandre Lacazette both had chances for the hosts.
Torreira's long-range shot was well saved by Jonas Lossl, while Lacazette had an effort disallowed for offside.
Arsenal continued to press after half-time and Torreira's superb finish from Aubameyang's clipped cross settled the contest with only seven minutes left.
Arsenal report | Huddersfield Town report

Burnley claimed their first win in nine Premier League matches as James Tarkowski’sgoal was enough to beat Brighton & Hove Albion.
But five minutes before half-time Tarkowski put them ahead, getting the final touch on Jack Cork’s goalbound shot.
Brighton threatened and Jurgen Locadia might have levelled but headed over with seven minutes remaining. 
See: Burnley report | Brighton report

A second-half winner by Callum Paterson earned a precious victory for Cardiff City and brought defeat for Ralph Hasenhuttl in his first match in charge of Southampton.
There were chances for both sides in an evenly-matched encounter at Cardiff City Stadium with Josh Murphy going close for the hosts in the first half and Charlie Austin narrowly shooting wide for the visitors.
Southampton pressed for an equaliser and Manolo Gabbiadini missed a late opportunity as Neil Warnock’s men held on to take three points.
Cardiff report | Southampton report

Marcus Rashford starred with one goal and two assists as Manchester United returned to winning ways, beating Fulham 4-1 at Old Trafford.
Ashley Young opened the scoring with a sweet strike on 13 minutes.
Juan Mata's 18-yard first-time effort, his 50th goal in the competition, doubled the lead.
Mata then turned provider as his cross was tapped in by Romelu Lukaku on 42 minutes.
Fulham remain bottom on nine.

West Ham United came from behind to record their third consecutive win, beating Crystal Palace 3-2.
Palace took a sixth-minute lead through James McArthur, who was first to poke in James Tomkins's towering header from a free-kick.
Three minutes after the break, Robert Snodgrass levelled the scores with a 20-yard curling shot.
West Ham report | Palace report

Chelsea inflicted the first Premier League defeat of the season upon Manchester City, with goals from N'Golo Kante and David Luiz earning a 2-0 win.
Leroy Sane and Raheem Sterling had early efforts denied by Kepa Arrizabalaga, before Chelsea took the lead at Stamford Bridge on the stroke of half-time.
Eden Hazard’s cutback from a counter-attack found Kante, who fired into the roof of the net.
David Luiz sealed the points, heading in Hazard’s 78th-minute corner as Kepa ensured a clean sheet with a fine late save from Gabriel Jesus.
Chelsea are in fourth place on 34.

Tottenham Hotspur halted Leicester City’s six-match unbeaten run with a 2-0 victory that lifted them back above Chelsea and Arsenal in the Premier League table.
Son Heung-min, leading the forward line in place of the rested Harry Kane, cut in from the right and whipped a fine curling strike into the top corner from 20 yards.
Lucas Moura slipped in Son, who picked out Dele Alli at the back post.
Leicester City remain ninth on 22 points.

Ashley Barnes and Phil Bardsley both had chances for Burnley in a goalless first half, while efforts from Naby Keita and James Milner were blocked for Liverpool.
Milner equalised eight minutes later with a low strike from outside the area after good work by Divock Origi.
Roberto Firmino, a substitute along with Mohamed Salah, put Liverpool in front on 69 minutes from Virgil van Dijk's pass, before Xherdan Shaqiri added a third from Salah's pass in stoppage time.
Burnley report | Liverpool report

Richarlison scored his seventh Premier League goal of the season as Everton drew 1-1 with Newcastle United.
Richarlison struck in the 38th minute at the far post after Gylfi SigurdssonAt the other end, Jordan Pickford denied DeAndre Yedlin at the other end.
Everton report | Newcastle report

A second-half strike from James Maddison helped Leicester City deny former Foxes manager Claudio Ranieri a second win in charge of Fulham.
Kasper Schmeichel made a brilliant save strike from Calum Chambers early in the first half, but could not deny Aboubakar Kamara on 42 minutes when the striker turned and finished off Aleksandar Mitrovic's flick-on from a narrow angle.
Fulham report | Leicester report

Wolverhampton Wanderers came from behind to earn a 2-1 victory against Chelsea at Molineux.
Wolves were level on 59 minutes when a through-ball from Morgan Gibbs-White, on his first PL start, found Raul Jimenez and he drilled a powerful shot between the legs of Kepa Arrizabalaga.
Joao Moutinho played in Matt Doherty and he slid the ball across goal to leave Diogo Jota with a simple finish.
Wolves report | Chelsea report

Manchester United in a 2-2 draw at Old Trafford.
Shkodran Mustafi forced a header past David De Gea at a corner to put Arsenal ahead on 26 minutes, but Anthony Martial quickly levelled from close range after Ander Herrera's cutback.
Marcos Rojo turned the ball into his own net under pressure from substitute Alexandre Lacazette to restore Arsenal’s lead on 68 minutes.
Both sides had chances to win it, with De Gea tipping away Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang’s shot and substitute Romelu Lukaku coming close at the other end.
Arsenal report

Tottenham Hotspur moved up to third in the Premier League table with a comfortable 3-1 victory over Southampton.
Playing at Wembley in front of new manager Ralph Hasenhuttl, Southampton went behind on nine minutes to Harry Kane, who turned in Christian Eriksen's cross.
Lucas Moura added a second six minutes after half-time, before Son Heung-min fired in their third four minutes later.
Southampton rallied and their efforts were rewarded when Charlie Austin converted their 18th shot of the match, from Steven Davis's long ball, in stoppage time.

Callum Wilson set the ball rolling for the hosts on five minutes when he headed in Ryan Fraser's cross for his eighth PL goal of the season.
Huddersfield Town pulled a goal back before half-time when Aaron Mooy's cross was guided towards Zanka who nodded the ball across goal for Terence Kongolo to head in his first PL goal for the club.
Huddersfield Town are 17th with 10. 
: AFC Bournemouth report | Huddersfield Town report

Brighton & Hove Albion eased to a comfortable 3-1 victory over Crystal Palace despite being reduced to 10 men in the first half.
Chris Hughton's side opened the scoring on 24 minutes, when Glenn Murray converted a penalty after James McArthur had fouled Jose Izquierdo.
Four minutes later Shane Duffy was sent off after a clash with Patrick van Aanholt.
Florin Andone extended Brighton's lead with a solo effort in first-half stoppage time.
Palace's second-half reply was limited to Luka Milivojevic's 81st-minute penalty after a foul on Wilfried Zaha.
Brighton report | Palace report

Lucas Perez scored his first Premier League double as West Ham United beat Cardiff City 3-1 at London Stadium.
Cardiff had the chance to take a 35th-minute lead when Marko Arnautovic fouled Junior Hoilett, but Lukasz Fabianski saved Joe Ralls’s penalty.
An injured Arnautovic was replaced by Perez, who volleyed in his first Premier League goal for the Hammers from Robert Snodgrass’s flick on 49 minutes.
Michail Antonio made it 3-0 with a glancing header from Snodgrass's corner.
Substitute Josh Murphy scrambled a late consolation for Cardiff, who remain 16th on 11.
West Ham report | Cardiff report

Manchester City restored their five-point lead over Liverpool at the top of the Premier League as a goal in each half by Leroy Sane and Riyad Mahrez secured a 2-1 win at Watford.
Ben Foster kept the Hornets in the match midway through the first half with a brilliant triple save from Mahrez twice and David Silva.
The Algerian winger doubled City's lead 11 minutes later when he swept in Gabriel Jesus’s left-wing cross.
Abdoulaye Doucoure gave Watford hope when he scrambled the ball in at the third attempt late on, but the champions saw out their 14th consecutive PL away victory.

Goals from Pedro and Ruben Loftus-Cheek earned Chelsea a 2-0 west London derby victory over Fulham that put the Blues third in the Premier League table. 
Pedro slotted in Chelsea's fourth-minute opener, their 1,000th home PL goal, after N'Golo Kante dispossessed Jean Michael Seri, surged forward and played in the Spaniard.
Olivier Giroud went close as the home side controlled the first half, but Calum Chambers twice forced Chelsea goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga into action for Claudio Ranieri's visitors after the break.
But substitute Loftus-Cheek wrapped up the win after being set up by Eden Hazard with eight minutes left, putting Maurizio Sarri's side on 31 points. 
Chelsea report | Fulham report

A Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang double inspired Arsenal to a thrilling 4-2 north London derby triumph over Tottenham Hotspur.
Eric Dier glanced in Christian Eriksen's free-kick before Harry Kane scored a penalty after Rob Holding's foul on Son Heung-min.
Arsenal report | Spurs report

An even Merseyside derby had been heading towards a goalless draw when, in the sixth minute of stoppage time, Virgil van Dijk's skied shot was parried by Jordan Pickford on to the bar and fell for Origi to score on his debut this season.
In an enthralling first half, Everton had threatened first at Anfield, Yerry Mina heading wide from seven yards. 
Alisson saved Andre Gomes's header from point-blank range, before Joe Gomez cleared the rebound off the line. At the other end, Pickford denied Xherdan Shaqiri when through on goal.
Liverpool mounted the pressure in the second half as Salah and then Mane each shot wide.
Liverpool report | Everton report

In the 77th minute, Andros Townsend doubled Palace's lead.Cheikhou Kouyate played a 40-yard pass into the forward, who then cut inside and superbly fired the ball into the back of the net.
Joe Hart saved efforts from Patrick van Aanholt and Wilfried Zaha to prevent Palace adding to their tally.
Crystal Palace report | Burnley report

Brighton & Hove Albion came from behind to beat 10-man Huddersfield Town 2-1.
Brighton completed their comeback when Florin Andone marked his first PL start with a goal, meeting March's cross to head in the winner.

James Maddison doubled the lead with a superb right-footed volley after collecting a pass from Marc Albrighton.
Watford had chances to hit back but Isaac Success, Roberto Pererya and substitute Andre Gray all failed to take them.
Leicester report | Watford report

Bernardo Silva opened the scoring when he converted the rebound after Asmir Begovic had parried Leroy Sane's cross.
Callum Wilson equalised on the stroke of half-time when he headed in a cross from Simon Francis.
Ilkay Gundogan ensured City maintained their 100 per cent PL home record when he made it 3-1 from Sane's low cross.
Manchester City report | AFC Bournemouth report

After hitting the side-netting, Chicharito added a second on 63 minutes after running on to Marko Arnautovic's flick-on.
Felipe Anderson made sure of the victory with a cool finish in stoppage time.
Newcastle report | West Ham report

Manchester United came from two goals behind to earn a 2-2 draw with Southampton at St Mary's Stadium. 
Saints opened the scoring after 13 minutes when Stuart Armstrong netted his third goal in two Premier League matches with a low drive.
Romelu Lukaku gave Man Utd a lifeline on 33 minutes with his first PL goal in 13 matches.
Marcus Rashford cut a low ball across the six-yard box and Ander Herrera smartly flicked it past Alex McCarthy.
Southampton report |

Junior Hoilett struck a spectacular winner as Cardiff City came from behind to beat Wolverhampton Wanderers 2-1.
The visitors took the lead on 18 minutes when Neil Etheridge palmed out Raul Jimenez’s header, only for Matt Doherty to pounce on the rebound.
Cardiff almost equalised in the 38th minute when Harry Arter let fly from the edge of the area with a shot that came back off the angle of post and crossbar.
The hosts then sealed their third win of the season when Hoilett curled a sumptuous first-time shot into the top corner from the left edge of the area.
Cardiff report |
